reviews.review: Works Ok. Sometimes drops connection in busy areas.No active noise canceling, but it mutes outside sounds well.Good, clear sound, but not audiofile quality, of course.Lasts ~6hours.Good for sleeping as it sits flush in the ear.Fits me better than Anker 4 NC or Sony XM3s.Easily connected to my Pixel 6a.
Value for money. It works perfectly for me at the gym.

I really like these earbuds, but the pairing button on the case broke within a couple weeks. Makes them unusable on any other devices, which is annoying. But regardless, they're comfortable and they sound great for the price. It's also nice that you can customize/disable the capacitive touch buttons with their app. As long as the pairing button on the case doesn't break on other units, they're a steal at the price.

These are my third sleep ear buds and ive finally landed on one that actually works. it only lasts about 8hrs, which is fine for me, but that’s something i feel other ear buds don’t deliver. it’s not too quiet where you can’t hear anything else (depending on the volume) so it works well for me. i highly recommend these and for the price, why wouldn’t you get them?!
Great product easy to set up easy to use

I really like them, they last a long time and are comfortable, but I don't know why sometimes they disconnect and reconnect on their own. This happens for about two seconds, up to twice a day, while I'm using them in the middle of a call.
I like this it's super good . It works good it don't work with the app but it works with the phone. Value  for money the connectivity is good. Soudn quality,  confort  easy of use

product_name: XIAOMI Redmi Buds 6 Pro, True-to-Life Audio, Hi-Res Audio with coaxial Dual Drivers, LDAC, Up to 55dB Active Noise Cancellation, Compatible with Android iPhone and Bluetooth Device (Space Black)

reviews.review: I am truly enjoying the audio experience. These headphones offer a significantly superior sound quality compared to Samsung. The depth of the sound, particularly the background elements and the bass, is quite impressive, especially considering the substantial price difference.
Very good.

Don't get me wrong, I purchased them at a big discount and I've absolutely love them they have better Active Noise Cancellation (and sound better too) than my Airpods pro 2 and it's not even close, it's amazing, like has better ANC than some of them that are double the price or more. love the Bluetooth LDAC codec, I've had no problems with connection even when forcing them at (priorize best quality at 990khz setting) battery life is ok, nothing to complain about,  the fast charging is great, the case itself feels premium and love the light bar battery indicator.My only problem with them is maybe the multipoint feature, it trips a little between devices when popping them out of the case and sometimes disconnect from the device I want to hear music (in that case is my phone most of the time) so I have to manually connect them again as a regular Bluetooth device, this is rare tho, like just 5-10% and another thing to mention is when using multipoint battery drains faster but not significantly faster, but other than that, the multipoint feature works great.Recommended, I'd probably go for this over the NC 4 liberty if similar price, it absolutely worths the price (plus in my opinion they look prettier than the NC).If cheaper, it's a no-brainer
Excelentes auriculares a un buen precio y tienen una buena cancelación de ruido
Excelente en calidad-precio.
Best earphone for the price 2025

La estación de carga se descarga rápido, solo me da para cargar los audífonos como tres o cuatro veces.La señal de Bluetooth no es muy buena, porque w veces se crea un especie de interferencia cuando estoy escuchando una música.También la señal es muy débil, porque se corta la conexión teniendo los audífonos puesta y el celular en el bolsillo.Tengo los Redmi Buds 3 Pro, y la duración de la batería un muy superior; y no sé corta la señal cuando tengo el celular en los bolsittos
I been using them for a week and now the app doesn't work and the buds battery doesn't last the amount they advertise.

product_name: Redmi Buds 6 Lite in-Ear Headphones, Dynamic 40dB Active Noise Cancellation, up to 37 Hours Battery Life, Titanium Membrane with 4 Sound Settings, AI Noise Cancellation, Google Fast Pair, Black

reviews.review: Is good quality for less money. I recommend. Original and sound good. Connectivity fastNice functional. Noice cancelling agree 👍.
If you’re looking for some low cost AirPod with nice canceling, this is the best choice

The Redmi Buds 6 lite are a great low-cost option for wireless BT headphones with decent audio and solid microphone quality, including microphone background noise cancellation (for voice/input audio). I ended up buying these after a deep reddit research dive because my parents kept complaining about background noise when I called them on my old BT headphones while washing dishes/doing other house chores, and these were recommended as a cheap option. The folks on reddit were right--with redmi buds lite I have no complaints! =) I can't comment on durability yet as I've only had them 2-3 months, but the case battery life seems great because I've only charged the case once. So far really enjoying these and very pleased with the microphone quality for ~$25.
They look and work really well

I'm not an audiophile, I also don't tend to purchase super expensive audio equipment. I just want decent bass and clear audio for listening to music/youtube videos and making calls,On both sides it's much better than the previous ones I've used around the same price from anker and even other redmi earbuds I bought a few years ago.The ANC isn't super impressive (see the price and lower your expectations); it's good enough for low level bassy sounds like machinery humming but high pitched, sudden, or sharp sounds pass through pretty easily.The transparency mode is actually very good. It presents external audio clearer than just having transparency mode off so if you need to hear occasional external sounds while listening to your music it's pretty good for that.Comfort is good for wearing all day in my experience. Battery life is good at mid volume, I haven't tried high volume and probably won't.Connecting with my phone is literally instant with FastPair both for initial pairing and regular use. It's connected before I even take them out of the case.
I bought a blue one but get a white one. Color is important to me. There’s no place to complain, I have to waste a lot of time to replace. I don’t know why xiaomi can be such irresponsible in USA.

Truth be told, this is as good or better as the Apple Airpods 4 with ANC. This has ANC (not as good as the higher priced ones) which works well enough for me.One great feature which my pricier Jabra did not have is that either of the buds works independently, so effectively you can double the battery life in a cinch.This also has Google fast pair which makes pairing with my Pixel literally 10 seconds.

product_name: CMF Buds 2a Wireless Earbuds 2025 New Active Noise Cancelling 42dB Hybrid ANC Bluetooth Headphones, 12.4mm Dynamic Driver for Big Bass, 4 Mic Clear Calls, Sport Ear Buds for iPhone, Android, Dark Grey

reviews.review: I bought these after watching current video reviews. I lucked out and got them brand new at 50% off the current retail price. They are a simple baseline model with less frills than the more expensive options such as the Pro2s. That being said they sound fantastic. The app is easy to navigate and makes them extra customizable. Battery life is fantastic. Honestly I'm completely impressed with the CMF 2a series. For a set of base model true wireless buds they lack nothing essential for music lovers. Nice build quality, stylish color optiins, and they sound awesome from the crisp clear highs down to the punchy bass filled lows.Overall a really great product that performs well for the price tag. Judging from these I'm willing to now possibly consider adding a set of Pros or choosing other CMF product purchases in the future.

Should you buy these? Yes.First of all, these are an incredible value, even though I'm not sure what the actual price is. I bought a pair today for $30, curious about how well these perform despite being so cheap, considering how well-liked they are.  I tested them on a set of tracks that are unbalanced, each in their own way (e.g. too heavy on the bass/treble/etc.) and somehow they all sounded good.  I don't know how that's even possible.  These little things have bass you can feel, which I've never experienced with any kind of earbud.  It's not something that I particularly enjoy, but a lot of people will, and it's impressive nevertheless.  When I like a pair of headphones I get a backup pair, so I just bought another pair of these and they were only $20.  After I bought them they went up to $40.  All of those prices are justifiable for the quality these provide, but I am very confused why the price keeps changing on me.But let's say they're supposed to be $40.  At that price point, you wouldn't think to compare them to Sony's WF-1000XM4 or Apple's Airpods Pro 2, but they sound better than both.  It's not that hard to sound better than Airpods, but there are other features worth comparing.  Sounding better than Sony's WF-1000XM4s, however—at somewhere between 6.75% and 13.5% of the cost—is pretty incredible.  Granted, they're definitely not more realistic, but these somehow manage to make everything sound good.  Senheiser's IE 600s are for realism, but I would not argue that they sound better.  When you're listening for fun, the CMF Buds 2a are the most fun.  Normally, I prefer uncolored, realistic sound even in a headphone I use for fun, but these are a rare exception.I love trying new headphones because you get to hear your favorite music in a new way.  Sometimes it's not a huge difference, but I hear more detail than average so I enjoy the subtle stuff.  I think the sound stage of these buds elevate the sound significantly.  You can really hear the details, even in a bad mix. You can hear the sound move so well and with such fluidity.  It's just hard to believe these are $20-40 Bluetooth headphones.I've used these for only a couple of hours now, so I can't speak to battery life, but I'm hoping they truly will make it through the workday.  They're surprisingly comfortable, and the medium tips actually fit great (usually I'm a small size). I like the design. Everything's plastic—and not plastic that feels particularly sturdy—but the design is nice.  While the headphones feel like they go into the case backwards (to me, at least), they snap in thanks to magnets and look nicer in that "backwards" position.  The case is very small and looks nice in a minimal way. The active noise canceling is good and comparable to the WF-1000XM4s.  I think the AirPods Pro 2 win in the ANC category by a hair.If there's one place I can fault these buds is in the touch controls.  I can turn ANC on and off, but so far I haven't been sucessful with any other option.  They just don't seem to respond well to taps.  I don't really care, though.  I find touch controls useful only when I can't control the volume and track through any other mechanism.  I find it much easier to make these adjustments on my phone or computer.  Still, I would prefer if I could get the touch controls to actually work.These buds are my new recommendation for non-audiophiles, and audiophiles who want a fun pair.  They're exceptional for the price, and would still be competitive at five times the cost.  I'm really glad I decided to give these a try.

Doesn't have auto pause when you remove from ear, transparency mode isn't the best and ANC works best with music. Now for the good stuff: sounds great and has the option to tune it to sound the way you want (very bass heavy with the option for even more bass), fits great, battery life is great, has dual connection and low lag mode and the magnet in case are really strong and the app is well designed. Overall I love these.

I bought it on Black Friday for $20. I was not expecting much, was getting them for phone calls. Oh boy... these really caught me off-guard, they are actually very good! I have only used them as of this review less than one day, but I have been trying to make them sound as good as the BOSE QC35ii headphones I have (BOSE sound is in another league).Equalizer/Sound:Recommended Equalizer settings on Nothing app:BASS: +6MID: +1TREBLE: 0Ultra Bass: Level 5For rock, these settings are the best you can probably get (of course they still sound fantastic outside of rock). I tested these for live-streams (gaming/shooting) and voices sounded normal-good (compared to my headphones), normal songs sounded good, instrumental music (from Elden Ring) sounded very good, rock (I tested Abracadavre, a song from Call of Duty: Black Ops 1) and at around second ~0:20 where the good part starts, sounded somehow disappointing *with the default Dirac equalizer setting*, but once I tested the customized equalizer I just showed earlier it sounded MUCH better (still not even close to the BOSE headphones, but they do sound from acceptable to good now). If you combine these settings with a separate equalizer app, you can probably make these sound much better. The ANC (Active Noise Cancelling) is, like mentioned in Linus Tech Tips, pretty decent-good, it is like 1/3 the strength of the BOSE headphones (ANC from CMF does not hurt the 1st time you use it, I recall the 1st time I used the BOSE ANC that I felt being inside a submarine very deep in the ocean).Microphones during calls: sounds very clear (in a room with metal fans that make strong white noise). I tested by calling myself to another phone.Case: It fits extremely tight on the small pockets that jeans have. So far has done it's  job of charging, but since this is day 1 I will not talk about this aside of saying it works.Connection: Tested on an Asus Zephyrus G15 GA503QR (Linux Pop-OS), Xiaomi Redmi Note 11 and Google Pixel 6. In all it connects fast and stable. Sometimes increasing the volume increases more loudly one bud first but then the other bud catches up, but normally they both do it at the same time. Audio to video latency, okay-good. When I start a YouTube video the audio kicks in at like second 1-2, but after that no noticeably latency (very slight latency whenever I saw someone in a video game shoot, the sound and visual recoil of gun did not match, maybe 0.2-0.4 ms latency guesstimating by eye).Ear tip fit: pretty good, I recommend trying the large one for a better seal, so the ANC is better (not by that much).Does it fit: Yes, it does not fall off at all, can sleep while wearing them comfortably (sleeping on the side).Is this worth it? Yes (in my case, for $20 this was a steal), but I will suggest looking the Plus version of these earbuds since (I believe, please check first) the equalizer settings on the Nothing app for that earbud is much more detailed and advanced, also you can modify how strong you want the ANC to be (and has like personalized audio, whatever that means). The CMF Buds 2 Plus is $80 and CMF Buds 2A $50, so if you see the Plus in discount closer to $50 I suggest you get those; otherwise Buds 2A for less than $30 is very good deal (both are reviewed in Short Circuit channel on YouTube). Pretty satisfied.Updated 12/7/25:1. Bluetooth range: Much better than my Bose, very surprised.2. Battery life is very good, was in a call for like 2 hours and still had like 65% I believe.3. This supports the feature that Airpods have of "seamlessly" connecting between multiple devices and switching fast (I have not tried it, but you need the Nothing app to enable it.Annoyances:1. No way to disable hang up calls and other call specific touch gestures. I accidentally hung up a call trying to adjust my buds.2. The touch sensor is VERY sensitive, and... essentially the WHOLE stick of the bud is detected by the sensors, so just adjusting them at the tip (the opposite side of the sensor's location) will still hang up the call, so be careful.3. If bud slides off your ear, use a smaller size. For me small size prevents them from falling off.So far very good and solid performance.

I am an almost permanent user of earbuds but tend to look to those with active noise cancelling and good sound quality. I am currently using Bose Qc 2's and (as ever) the reproduction is great but the mic quality is awful.Generally I've found that cheaper earbuds provide a better balance, reproduction is ok with a better mic quality for outgoing calls.I keep the "high end" earbuds with me all of the time but sometimes I may forget to take them so I keep "emergency spare earbuds" in my vehicles "just in case."These were recommended to me by a friend and so far I have been pleasantly surprised.Reproduction is reasonable and outgoing call quality  is great.They are not my style for comfortable fit (like Apple earbuds) however they are not uncomfortable either.The case is very small and charged with usb c.So for the purpose that they were bought for I am very happy.

product_name: JBL Vibe Beam - True Wireless JBL Deep Bass Sound Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.2, Water & Dust Resistant, Hands-free call with VoiceAware, Up to 32 hours of battery life (Black)

reviews.review: Sound proof af and barely ever need charging. I got these for my husband about a year ago and he uses them every single day for his job events. They never die on him! He said he only charges them about once a week and uses them for about 3-4 hours a day. He let me use them during the first month our newborn came home and they saved my life since our baby had colic. They are also very compact so they fit inside of his pocket perfectly, even with a case. The bass quality is superb for such little buds too. Definitely worth the price and after a year they havnt lost any quality in sound.

I rarely write reviews...but I have to rave about these.These are some of the best earbuds I have owned.I bought a pair of $160 Nothing headphones before this and these beat those out.-Great Bass-Super customizable settings-Comfortable in the ear-Responsive-Great battery life-"Find my earbud" featureI feel like I will never go back to any other type of buds.

They connected to my phone quite easily. The sound is excellent. However, they sometimes fall out of my ears; I might need to try different earbuds. The quality is excellent. The charge lasts quite a long time, even with frequent use.

The Good:1. I paid $24 for these back in November of '24 as part of a Black Friday special and am quite happy with the purchase.2. They sound really, really good -- but only when I apply pressure to them, push them into my ears and hold them.3. I dropped one into a sink full of water for two or three seconds (totally submerged). I expected it to die but it still played! (Another time sweat ran down into my ear and conked it out for the evening.)4. The free JBL Headphones app has an equalizer, as well as some other features, which will allow you to make some adjustments to the sound ( I tried it but didn't notice a big difference and ended up uninstalling it to free up memory).5. Some people claim you can mold your own earbud tips and improve the fit and sound quality.The Bad:1. They don't fit snuggly. I tried the different sized rubber ear tips that came with it and none of them are quite right.2. The sound is very thin. This is 100% a fit issue. Shove them in and hold them and they sound really good.3. When the batteries get low you get an audible "battery is low" message. Fine but as the battery gets lower, the message eventually stats coming every twenty seconds or so (maybe faster). It's quite annoying.4. Getting them in and out of the case is somewhat of a PITA due to some design issues.

This review is about the audio features of the JBL Vibe Beam earbuds.I'm an audio engineer so audio quality is very important to me. As such, I use wired connections as much as possible to maintain the integrity of the audio signal.  However, many newer consumer-level products no longer have audio jacks, so I finally decided to invest in some wireless earbuds as a backup to the other earphones and headphones that I use.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money as I didn't foresee myself using this product very much, and since this is my first foray into wireless audio earphones, if they were just ok or they broke after a while, then I wouldn't feel too bad about the little money that I spent.  Also, I wanted to focus on finding wireless earbuds with excellent audio quality first as I already have an excellent high-end bluetooth earpiece for cell phone use, and I wouldn't be using this product as a bluetooth headset for my phone.After doing much research, I chose the JBL Vibe Beam's as they were at my price point, I'm familiar with JBL products, and I could reasonably expect that they were likely deliver the high audio quality that I've come to expect from JBL products.  In my research, I read reviews that complained about the harshness of the high end with high frequency instruments like cymbals or the lack of bass, so I was a bit concerned.When I received and started listening to my JBL Vibe Beams I understood what people were talking about.  However, to correct the issues, first, one must have a great fit of the earbuds in their ears.  I'm fortunate, in that with the medium tips that were already installed on the Vibe Beams, they made a snug fit in my ears right out of the box.  If you find that these earbuds do not fit well in your ears it might be worthwhile to invest in a separate set of variable sized earbud tips, or try tips from one of your other well-fitting earbuds, if you have them.  Once the earbuds were seated properly in my ear, that took care of the poor bass issue. (I have not worn them long-term so I can't speak to them falling out of my ear, as others have mentioned, but they seem to stay in pretty well.)For the misaligned frequency response issue, fortunately, the JBL Headphone app that you can install on your cell phone includes a ten-band graphic equalizer that you can use to make adjustments to the frequency response of your earbuds.  After listening to several of the reference tracks I use to check new audio equipment or my mixes against, I found that the only adjustments needed were carving out some of the upper midrange and making a very slight boost in the bottom end of the lower frequency spectrum.  I've included a screenshot of my EQ curve which I based on the Bass preset in the JBL app.  You can't tell as there is no dB scale on the side, but I needed to cut or boost by only 1-2 dB.  I find that my new EQ curve gives a more balanced frequency response than what came out of the box, and matches up well against the reference speaker system and headphones that I use for my audio mixing and mastering work.  I invite you to use my EQ curve as a starting point and adjust as sounds best to you.I also read reviews complaining about the apparent lack of volume of the Vibe Beams.  I connected the JBL's to several different sources (phone, computer, TV, MP3 player, etc.) and I found that the overall maximum volume (with limiter off) is relatively lower than wired speaker versions.  However, the input to the JBL's is relative to the maximum output of the source itself.  I found that the loudest level I could get came from my iPhone and the lowest level output came from my MP3 player (which probably doesn't offer much output anyway being a tiny portable unit).  As a comparison, I did a side-by-side test of the JBL's with my wife's AirPods (2nd gen).  What I found was that the JBL's offered an almost identical audio output level as the AirPods with any of the sources I used so that confirmed that the output level of the JBL's has more to do with the source (and the source material as some songs are mastered at a lower volume than other songs) than with the earbuds themselves.  During my test, I put the JBL's at their maximum volume output (one tap at a time on the left bud to raise the volume).  Also, I noticed during my testing that the AirPods had a pleasing midrange sound perfect for listening to podcasts or watching video, but the JBL's excelled at full-range sound on the bottom and top ends of the frequency spectrum which made them sound much better over all and well-suited for music or listening to explosive action scenes in movies.And speaking of movies, the JBL app has a switchable audio/video mode.  The video mode reduces the latency of the delivery of audio against picture, so there isn't a noticeable lip-sync issue with dialogue in a scene.  However, there is a slight degradation in the audio quality of 'video' mode versus 'audio' mode, but you will have to make the determination if the change in audio quality is acceptable to you.As a side note, I included a picture of the inner side of the earbuds.  The 'L' and 'R' designations on the earbuds are tiny as you can see, plus they are the same color as the earbuds themselves, so they are very hard to see.  I wish JBL had made the L/R letters bigger or at least made them a different color so they would be easier to see.The pairing process was fairly easy with all my bluetooth-capable devices and the range was good, only dropping out after walking approximately 60-70 feet from the source.  There was one momentary dropout during my listening but that could be due to my wife using her AirPods the same time as I was using the JBL's.I can't speak to the other features of the JBL Vibe Beams as I don't intend to use them, but as far as audio quality goes, with just a few minor tweaks, these bluetooth earbuds can go from sounding like a $50 pair of earbuds to a $500 pair of reference earphones.

These are the best earbuds and have amazing sound. The color is very good and with the USBC charging it is very compatible with everything. They fit comfortably in my ear and have a very good battery life.

What I found was that the JBL's offered an almost identical audio output level as the AirPods with any of the sources I used so that confirmed that the output level of the JBL's has more to do with the source (and the source material as some songs are mastered at a lower volume than other songs) than with the earbuds themselves.  During my test, I put the JBL's at their maximum volume output (one tap at a time on the left bud to raise the volume).  Also, I noticed during my testing that the AirPods had a pleasing midrange sound perfect for listening to podcasts or watching video, but the JBL's excelled at full-range sound on the bottom and top ends of the frequency spectrum which made them sound much better over all and well-suited for music or listening to explosive action scenes in movies.And speaking of movies, the JBL app has a switchable audio/video mode.  The video mode reduces the latency of the delivery of audio against picture, so there isn't a noticeable lip-sync issue with dialogue in a scene.  However, there is a slight degradation in the audio quality of 'video' mode versus 'audio' mode, but you will have to make the determination if the change in audio quality is acceptable to you.As a side note, I included a picture of the inner side of the earbuds.  The 'L' and 'R' designations on the earbuds are tiny as you can see, plus they are the same color as the earbuds themselves, so they are very hard to see.  I wish JBL had made the L/R letters bigger or at least made them a different color so they would be easier to see.The pairing process was fairly easy with all my bluetooth-capable devices and the range was good, only dropping out after walking approximately 60-70 feet from the source.  There was one momentary dropout during my listening but that could be due to my wife using her AirPods the same time as I was using the JBL's.I can't speak to the other features of the JBL Vibe Beams as I don't intend to use them, but as far as audio quality goes, with just a few minor tweaks, these bluetooth earbuds can go from sounding like a $50 pair of earbuds to a $500 pair of reference earphones.

These are the best earbuds and have amazing sound. The color is very good and with the USBC charging it is very compatible with everything. They fit comfortably in my ear and have a very good battery life.

product_name: JBL Vibe Beam - True Wireless JBL Deep Bass Sound Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.2, Water & Dust Resistant, Hands-free call with VoiceAware, Up to 32 hours of battery life (White)

reviews.review: Sound proof af and barely ever need charging. I got these for my husband about a year ago and he uses them every single day for his job events. They never die on him! He said he only charges them about once a week and uses them for about 3-4 hours a day. He let me use them during the first month our newborn came home and they saved my life since our baby had colic. They are also very compact so they fit inside of his pocket perfectly, even with a case. The bass quality is superb for such little buds too. Definitely worth the price and after a year they havnt lost any quality in sound.

I rarely write reviews...but I have to rave about these.These are some of the best earbuds I have owned.I bought a pair of $160 Nothing headphones before this and these beat those out.-Great Bass-Super customizable settings-Comfortable in the ear-Responsive-Great battery life-"Find my earbud" featureI feel like I will never go back to any other type of buds.

They connected to my phone quite easily. The sound is excellent. However, they sometimes fall out of my ears; I might need to try different earbuds. The quality is excellent. The charge lasts quite a long time, even with frequent use.

The Good:1. I paid $24 for these back in November of '24 as part of a Black Friday special and am quite happy with the purchase.2. They sound really, really good -- but only when I apply pressure to them, push them into my ears and hold them.3. I dropped one into a sink full of water for two or three seconds (totally submerged). I expected it to die but it still played! (Another time sweat ran down into my ear and conked it out for the evening.)4. The free JBL Headphones app has an equalizer, as well as some other features, which will allow you to make some adjustments to the sound ( I tried it but didn't notice a big difference and ended up uninstalling it to free up memory).5. Some people claim you can mold your own earbud tips and improve the fit and sound quality.The Bad:1. They don't fit snuggly. I tried the different sized rubber ear tips that came with it and none of them are quite right.2. The sound is very thin. This is 100% a fit issue. Shove them in and hold them and they sound really good.3. When the batteries get low you get an audible "battery is low" message. Fine but as the battery gets lower, the message eventually stats coming every twenty seconds or so (maybe faster). It's quite annoying.4. Getting them in and out of the case is somewhat of a PITA due to some design issues.

This review is about the audio features of the JBL Vibe Beam earbuds.I'm an audio engineer so audio quality is very important to me. As such, I use wired connections as much as possible to maintain the integrity of the audio signal.  However, many newer consumer-level products no longer have audio jacks, so I finally decided to invest in some wireless earbuds as a backup to the other earphones and headphones that I use.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money as I didn't foresee myself using this product very much, and since this is my first foray into wireless audio earphones, if they were just ok or they broke after a while, then I wouldn't feel too bad about the little money that I spent.  Also, I wanted to focus on finding wireless earbuds with excellent audio quality first as I already have an excellent high-end bluetooth earpiece for cell phone use, and I wouldn't be using this product as a bluetooth headset for my phone.After doing much research, I chose the JBL Vibe Beam's as they were at my price point, I'm familiar with JBL products, and I could reasonably expect that they were likely deliver the high audio quality that I've come to expect from JBL products.  In my research, I read reviews that complained about the harshness of the high end with high frequency instruments like cymbals or the lack of bass, so I was a bit concerned.When I received and started listening to my JBL Vibe Beams I understood what people were talking about.  However, to correct the issues, first, one must have a great fit of the earbuds in their ears.  I'm fortunate, in that with the medium tips that were already installed on the Vibe Beams, they made a snug fit in my ears right out of the box.  If you find that these earbuds do not fit well in your ears it might be worthwhile to invest in a separate set of variable sized earbud tips, or try tips from one of your other well-fitting earbuds, if you have them.  Once the earbuds were seated properly in my ear, that took care of the poor bass issue. (I have not worn them long-term so I can't speak to them falling out of my ear, as others have mentioned, but they seem to stay in pretty well.)For the misaligned frequency response issue, fortunately, the JBL Headphone app that you can install on your cell phone includes a ten-band graphic equalizer that you can use to make adjustments to the frequency response of your earbuds.  After listening to several of the reference tracks I use to check new audio equipment or my mixes against, I found that the only adjustments needed were carving out some of the upper midrange and making a very slight boost in the bottom end of the lower frequency spectrum.  I've included a screenshot of my EQ curve which I based on the Bass preset in the JBL app.  You can't tell as there is no dB scale on the side, but I needed to cut or boost by only 1-2 dB.  I find that my new EQ curve gives a more balanced frequency response than what came out of the box, and matches up well against the reference speaker system and headphones that I use for my audio mixing and mastering work.  I invite you to use my EQ curve as a starting point and adjust as sounds best to you.I also read reviews complaining about the apparent lack of volume of the Vibe Beams.  I connected the JBL's to several different sources (phone, computer, TV, MP3 player, etc.) and I found that the overall maximum volume (with limiter off) is relatively lower than wired speaker versions.  However, the input to the JBL's is relative to the maximum output of the source itself.  I found that the loudest level I could get came from my iPhone and the lowest level output came from my MP3 player (which probably doesn't offer much output anyway being a tiny portable unit).  As a comparison, I did a side-by-side test of the JBL's with my wife's AirPods (2nd gen).  What I found was that the JBL's offered an almost identical audio output level as the AirPods with any of the sources I used so that confirmed that the output level of the JBL's has more to do with the source (and the source material as some songs are mastered at a lower volume than other songs) than with the earbuds themselves.  During my test, I put the JBL's at their maximum volume output (one tap at a time on the left bud to raise the volume).  Also, I noticed during my testing that the AirPods had a pleasing midrange sound perfect for listening to podcasts or watching video, but the JBL's excelled at full-range sound on the bottom and top ends of the frequency spectrum which made them sound much better over all and well-suited for music or listening to explosive action scenes in movies.And speaking of movies, the JBL app has a switchable audio/video mode.  The video mode reduces the latency of the delivery of audio against picture, so there isn't a noticeable lip-sync issue with dialogue in a scene.  However, there is a slight degradation in the audio quality of 'video' mode versus 'audio' mode, but you will have to make the determination if the change in audio quality is acceptable to you.As a side note, I included a picture of the inner side of the earbuds.  The 'L' and 'R' designations on the earbuds are tiny as you can see, plus they are the same color as the earbuds themselves, so they are very hard to see.  I wish JBL had made the L/R letters bigger or at least made them a different color so they would be easier to see.The pairing process was fairly easy with all my bluetooth-capable devices and the range was good, only dropping out after walking approximately 60-70 feet from the source.  There was one momentary dropout during my listening but that could be due to my wife using her AirPods the same time as I was using the JBL's.I can't speak to the other features of the JBL Vibe Beams as I don't intend to use them, but as far as audio quality goes, with just a few minor tweaks, these bluetooth earbuds can go from sounding like a $50 pair of earbuds to a $500 pair of reference earphones.

product_name: XIAOMI TWSEJ04LS Redmi Airdots Earphones, Bluetooth, Sweatproof, True Wireless Earbuds, Global Version - Black, Small

reviews.review: ¡Excelente!

Like I assume many others have, I looked at this product as a cheaper alternative to the Apple AirPods. To be entirely honest, I was expecting mediocre sound quality and battery life. I turned out to be delightfully surprised by how much I like these earphones.The sound quality is very clear, perhaps not "audiophile" tier, but let's be honest: no earphones are audiophile quality at $30. I've heard people complain about latency when watching videos. I personally haven't experienced that. Whenever I watch a YouTube video, I don't notice any latency, though I suppose that I could be not as sensitive to that as other people.  The battery life is also pretty decent (not mind-blowing, but solid).  The Bluetooth is easy to set up as per the included instruction booklet; pairing them with my iPhone 6s was a cinch.They are comfortable to wear. I'm usually not a fan of the squishy rubber found in a lot of earphones—I usually wear over-the-ear headphones or hard plastic ones—but for some reason, I think these earphones are comfortable. Differently sized rubber pieces are included, in case you prefer a larger or smaller size.The only gripe I have with this product is that no charging cable was included. I mean, Micro USB cords are ubiquitous enough, so it's not egregious.

*Third revision* getting the headphones to pair to each other was a bit of a nuisance and the left bud seems to have some connection issues as far as the charging case is concerned. Once paired successfully, they function great as headphones, and the sound cancelling is great. The fit is also very nice. So aside from the pairing/charging issues I've come across in my short time I find them to be pretty good. *update* I've used the buds for the last day and have been able to discern where the problems lie. The connection issue is solved pretty simply by turning the left bud off and on again, and when I looked closer at the charging case I noticed that the prongs in the left compartment were considerable shorter than the right ones and one of them was even half stuck under the plastic! This rendered the left bud unchargeable because it couldn't complete the connection. *new* used a thumbtack to gently pry the stuck prong out and all has been well for the last few days of continued use. I will say that, as someone with smaller ears, the fit, though quite snug, became uncomfortable after prolonged usage (more than an hour and a half). 4 stars because of the initial pairing/charging issues

I absolutely love these ear buds. For the price they are really nice. I watch you tube, listen to Spotify and the sound quality is wonderful. The battery life is good. The best part of these is that they fit so snug in my ears I can’t hear my husband snore at night. Thanks! Will purchase again.

I ordered two sets. I was very happy with one pair as the sound quality and battery life were very good and they are comfortable to wear. But the second pair was a disaster as the Bluetooth connection kept breaking so the sound would come and goI returned it. But I am hopeful it was just that pair as the other one was very good. So I have ordered another pair. I am keeping my fingers crossed they will be as good as the pair I kept.

If you looking for a cheap headphones but with quality sound these are it. Everyone complaining the left didn’t work, but if you read the directions it clearly states sync the left pair by itself. What makes these headphones great is that each pair can be used independently. Would recommend to anyone who wants true wireless for half the cost.

Bought Xioami's Airdots from Alibaba Express about a year ago, and I was super impressed. Very good quality, good bass, and cheap.But this time I got impatient and bought from Amazon for the sweet 2-day delivery. Crap! They crackle on certain frequencies and it's unlistenable. Even the start-up sounds crackle. Really annoying too, because I need the charging case because I lost my other pair's... but it also has a bad connection to the pins. Probably due to the earbud tip size which was included with my AliExpress order...I would advise not this seller.

Lo compre porque me habian regalado un Xiaomi Redmi 7 y quise comprar más productos de la marca. ¡Me encantó! Excelente calidad de sonido, la bateria dura bastante, excelente para hacer ejercicio y lo mejor es que te lo pones y no sientes como si lo tuvieras, son super suave y livianos. No molestan al oido y se mantiene seguro, por lo que puedes correr, saltas e incluso bailar con los Airdotes puestos y no se caen. ¡Excelente!

Xiaomi Paquete de Sonido Mi Altavoz: Compacto, Potente y VersátilEl Xiaomi Paquete de Sonido Mi Altavoz es un dispositivo portátil que combina diseño elegante, calidad de sonido superior y resistencia, ideal para quienes buscan disfrutar de música en cualquier lugar.Diseño y PortabilidadEste altavoz cuenta con un diseño compacto y ligero, lo que lo hace fácil de transportar. Su estructura interna incluye altavoces magnéticos duales y un radiador pasivo, ofreciendo un sonido dinámico y envolvente. Además, su acabado moderno y minimalista lo convierte en un accesorio atractivo.Calidad de SonidoGracias a su tecnología avanzada, el altavoz ofrece una experiencia auditiva excepcional. Su configuración acústica permite disfrutar de graves potentes y un sonido claro, ideal para música, podcasts o llamadas. También es compatible con conexión TWS, lo que permite emparejar dos altavoces para crear un sonido estéreo envolvente.Duración de BateríaCon una batería de alta capacidad, este altavoz puede reproducir música hasta por 10 horas con una sola carga. Su puerto de carga tipo C asegura una recarga rápida y eficiente, perfecta para quienes están siempre en movimiento.ResistenciaEl Xiaomi Mi Altavoz cuenta con certificación IP67, lo que lo hace resistente al agua y al polvo. Esto lo convierte en una opción ideal para uso en exteriores, ya sea en la playa, el parque o durante actividades al aire libre.ConectividadEquipado con Bluetooth 5.4, este altavoz garantiza una conexión estable y rápida con dispositivos compatibles. Además, permite realizar llamadas manos libres con un solo toque, añadiendo comodidad a su funcionalidad.ConclusiónEl Xiaomi Paquete de Sonido Mi Altavoz es una excelente opción para quienes buscan un altavoz portátil que combine calidad de sonido, resistencia y diseño compacto. Su versatilidad lo hace perfecto para cualquier ocasión, desde reuniones en casa hasta aventuras al aire libre.Pros:- Diseño compacto y elegante.- Calidad de sonido excepcional.- Resistencia al agua y al polvo (IP67).- Duración de batería prolongada.Contras:- Potencia limitada para espacios muy grandes.- No incluye efectos de iluminación personalizables.

product_name: XIAOMI Redmi Buds 4 Active, Advanced Bluetooth® 5.3, 12mm Dynamic Driver, Google Fast Pair, Up to 28 Hours* Long Listening time with case

reviews.review: I recently purchased the Xiaomi Redmi Buds 4 Active and I’m absolutely impressed with them. For the price, they deliver exceptional sound quality, comfort, and functionality that I didn’t expect at this price point.Sound Quality:The 12mm dynamic driver produces clear, balanced sound with deep bass and crisp treble. Whether I’m listening to music, watching videos, or taking calls, the sound quality is rich and immersive. The audio is loud enough to block out background noise, but still clear and precise, which is great for workouts or commuting.Bluetooth Connectivity:The Bluetooth® 5.3 connection is super stable and ensures there are no drops or interruptions, even when I’m walking around or moving my head. The connection pairs quickly and smoothly with my phone and other Bluetooth devices. The Google Fast Pair feature is a convenient addition, allowing me to connect the buds to my phone instantly.Battery Life:The 28 hours of listening time with the case is impressive. Even after long listening sessions, I don’t need to worry about charging them constantly. I can go through an entire workday or long trips without having to charge them, and when they do need a charge, it’s quick and easy with the compact case.Comfort & Fit:The buds are lightweight and fit comfortably in my ears. They don’t feel heavy or bulky, and they stay securely in place even when I’m on the move. I can wear them for hours without discomfort, which is important for my long listening sessions or calls.Design:The Graphite Black color is sleek and modern, with a nice matte finish. The case is compact, making it easy to throw into my pocket or bag without taking up too much space. The overall design feels premium, especially considering the price.Conclusion:Overall, the Xiaomi Redmi Buds 4 Active are a fantastic choice if you’re looking for affordable yet high-quality earbuds. The sound quality, Bluetooth connection, and long battery life make them an excellent value. If you're looking for reliable wireless earbuds for everyday use, I highly recommend these.
Excellent choice in this price best quality
i bought them for like 15 bucks and i mean they have a decent sound quality and work really goodI wish they sound louder to be honest

I recently purchased the Xiaomi Redmi Buds 4 Active for my wife and myself, and I am extremely impressed with their performance! The sound quality is exceptional, with crisp highs and deep bass thanks to the 12mm dynamic driver. Whether I'm listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls, the audio experience is clear and immersive. The Bluetooth 5.3 connection is super stable, and I’ve had no issues with connectivity or dropouts.The fit is incredibly comfortable. The earbuds come with multiple ear tip sizes, ensuring a secure and snug fit for different ear shapes. I can wear them for hours without any discomfort, and the noise isolation is great, blocking out most external sounds, which enhances the listening experience even more.The battery life is impressive as well. I’ve been able to use them for several hours on a single charge, and the charging case provides plenty of additional power for multiple uses. The touch controls are responsive and make it easy to adjust volume, skip tracks, and take calls without having to pull out my phone.Overall, these earbuds are an incredible value for the price. The Xiaomi Redmi Buds 4 Active deliver on sound quality, comfort, and battery life, making them a perfect choice for anyone looking for high-quality wireless earbuds. Highly recommended!

I had previously been using truck stop earbuds (several different types), and they are all terrible. When I bought this item I was like "I like my other Xiaomi products, let's try this one". Audio quality is _great_. That's both "listening to music" audio quality and also "other people say that they can hear me perfectly on phone calls" quality. Battery life is also great. The device paired instantly with my Pixel and setup was basically zero steps. Three sizes of ear cushions are included, the default ones fit me without any need for swapping. I was really amazed at how other people on the phone said "Sure I can hear you fine, why are you asking?" Never had that experience with the cheap earbuds :) Thoroughly recommend these, at least for Android users - I haven't tried on iPhone.

product_name: XIAOMI Redmi Buds 5 Wireless Earphone - 46dB Active Noise Canceling, 40 Hour Battery Life, Bluetooth 5.3, Black

reviews.review: these are my second pair. these are great earbuds for the price, great quality of sound, feel really comfortable on the ear and not like they're going to fall, and they do include three sizes of silicone tips to fit different ears. if you live outside the US (or have a VPN) you can download the app for useful features, my favorite being find my earbuds which lets you track the case, or each earbud separately by making them play a loud sound. the noise cancellation is great, I ride bikes as a passenger a lot and these help tune out all the traffic noise, and the microphone picks up your voice even in those loud scenarios. the battery's amazing, it can last the whole week using with the case, and I haven't had my earbuds die on me even after 4 - 5 hours.  I know this can be bought separately, but I would love to see a protective case included, as you can see, mine are a little scuffed because of having them in drawers, bags or sometimes dropping them. on that same topic of dropping those, I'm very clumsy, and I have dropped them a few times and they still resist the impact, especially the case which with some other earbuds has broken for me. I do own a Redmi phone so I've never had any compatibility or connectivity issues, they connect really fast and rarely get disconnected by moving around.

They have great sound quality and connectivity features. For the price, I’d say they’re a great option. The only issue is that they fit a bit too large for women who have trouble with in-ear sizes, so they tend to slip out.
Excellent product!!

I’ve been using it for about half a year in a loud place — a furniture manufacturing building. It works well enough for the price, has a good battery, decent sound quality, and effective noise reduction. The sky blue color looks more interesting than plain white

These $47 earbuds sound better, have better active noise cancellation and are all around so much better than the $249.99 earbuds I bought have a touchscreen case (that I shall not mention the name because I am still a huge supporter of of this company). I'm a sound engineer (for live sound) so when I want to put in earbuds I want them to be the best. And so far these are it for me. Though you can not get the app in America so to access all the features, it doesn't matter. Redmi (English version) earbuds are where it's at...... Side note. I live in America, however I do have the supportive app because I have a VPN from Thailand.But like I said, it doesn't really matter if you can get the supportive app or not. I still give the 7 out of 5 stars (yes, I know what I did there).
Cómodos
Todo bien, todo bien embalado, bien producto y completamente original
Son excelentes , me encantan el sonido que tienen

product_name: XIAOMI OpenWear Stereo Hi-Res LHDC Earbuds, 17x12mm Dynamic Driver, Up to 38.5h Battery Life, Dual-mic with AI Noise Reduction (Sandstone Beige)

reviews.review: These Xiaomi OpenWear Stereo Hi-Res LHDC Earbuds are comfortable to wear, and the sound is pretty good...but for several reasons, I was torn between giving them three stars or four.  I'm going to preface my review by mentioning that I'm using them with a Xiaomi phone (13T Pro) because the experience of pairing and using them will likely be different on non-Xiaomi devices and because Xiaomi phones have a following here but aren't widely used in the United States.As soon as I opened the charger case and took out the headphones they were recognized by my phone and a pop-up menu came on my display to pair them.  I didn't need to go into the Bluetooth menu or Bluetooth Pairing Mode first, but that's almost certainly because I'm already using a Xiaomi phone.The pop-up menu may suggest that you go to the Play Store to download the Xiaomi Headphones App.  A bar code for the app is also included in the packaging of the headphones.  The problem if you live in the United States is that the Xiaomi Headphones App is indeed available in the Play Store, but not for download here.  You can download the Android app directly from Xiaomi's website in Taiwan or likely find it on an APK Site, although downloading it directly from Xiaomi is probably the safer choice.If you already own a Xiaomi smartphone running HyperOS, then you don't need the app because all of the menu options available in the app are baked directly into HyperOS.  If you go into the list of paired Bluetooth devices on your phone and click the right arrow a menu with headphone options  (see pics) comes up that's identical to the interface from the separate headphones app.You can specify what happens when you single, double, and long press the right and left earbuds, choose between using AAC and SBC Bluetooth codecs (more on that particular setting in a moment--but if you read no further, NEVER USE THE AAC BLUETOOTH CODEC ON  AN ANDROID DEVICE), and manually enable the ANC which does very little on my phone--possibly because it isn't compatible with the AI Features in HyperOS.  I can tell when ANC is turned on and off, but it has so little practical effect in terms of reducing ambient noise that activating it is pointless.  In the menu options ANC shows up under Laboratory  Functions as Comfort and noise reduction and needs to be manually enabled every time you connect the headphones.  Since this is a Laboratory Function, that probably means it's either experimental or still in active development.  The other possible reason it's not part of the main controls may be that the ANC works better on some devices than others, since it's a function that relies heavily on AI to work.To be fair to Xiaomi---the ANC in Bluetooth headphones from Bose, Sony, and Samsung also relies on AI to work, unlike older wired headphones, where the ANC functioning was completely hardware-based and built into the physical body of the headphones themselves.  Bluetooth ANC headphones often require an app and attempt to leverage the AI Capabilities built into your smartphone CPU to do most of the noise-cancelling heavy lifting.Earbuds don't offer sound quality comparable to over-the-ear headphones at the same price point, but you're sacrificing great sound for convenience and portability.  As far as earbuds go, these Xiaomi OpenEar sound quite good with nice definition and a balanced range that keeps trebly music from sounding shrill or bass-heavy music from sounding muddy.  I own earbuds from Skull Candy, Sony, Xiaomi (from their cheaper Redmi line), and Zipforce and these easily sound the best.I also appreciate the ear hooks because I have trouble with fit and comfort with some earbuds.  These stay in place over the ear, and I don't have to worry about them popping out and losing one or both.  Since they sit just outside of the ear, wearing them causes no discomfort or ear irritation over extended periods of use--problems that I often encounter with in-ear style earbuds.So if these sound good and are comfortable, why was I strongly tempted to give them three stars instead of four?The gesture commands don't work as well as they should.  Using a single tap to raise or lower volume is fine although I wish a single tap didn't change the volume quite so much--but the double tap commands to stop and restart music don't work reliably to the point where I've given up on even trying to use them--if I'm at a register or in another situation where I would normally want to pause music I turn down the volume instead because turning down the volume actually works.  Using the double tap on either earbud more often than not gets registered as two separate taps to change the volume or as a single long tap to access Google Assistant (Gemini) but since accessing the assistant makes it ready to listen, I didn't realize that the assistant on my phone was being activated.While the ANC does little on my phone call quality is good even in noisy environments and people at the other end of calls can always seem to hear me so there is some kind of noise cancelling going on with phone calls that does work well.Now a quick warning about AAC:In the Audio Menu for the headphones under Audio Quality you can choose between AAC which is listed as High Quality and SBC which is listed as Standard Quality.  That's not an accurate description on Android.  SBC has been capable of high definition sound since Bluetooth 5.0 and AAC is an Apple Bluetooth codec that works very poorly on Android devices.  Even if you're listening to a music source with the AAC Audio Codec you shouldn't use the AAC Bluetooth codec thinking that it passes through the sound.  Despite sharing the same name the AAC Audio Codec and Bluetooth codec are two separate things.  The AAC audio codec is capable of reproducing full CD-quality sound.  The AAC Bluetooth codec is not.  The AAC Bluetooth Codec re-encodes audio rather than passing it through even on Apple devices.The menu toggle for the headphones allowed me to switch between AAC and SBC on the fly while listening to songs.  With a lot of music, you can barely tell any difference between the two.  But with songs that are difficult to reproduce because there are multiple instruments playing simultaneously or music that uses reverb to create atmosphere and space the AAC Bluetooth Codec cuts off audio frequencies well within the range of normal human hearing.  Sound is clipped and songs have noticeably less range.Final Verdict:  If having effective ANC is an important feature, then I definitely can't recommend the Xiaomi OpenWear Stereo Hi-Res LHDC Earbuds.  The tap gestures beyond single taps to change volume also work poorly.  But these are very comfortable to wear, they sound nice, and if you're using a Xiaomi phone running HyperOS, all of the headphone controls from the separate headphones app are baked right into the OS.  For me, these were worth the money, but they may not be the best choice for everyone--especially in the United States, where Xiaomi phones aren't that widely used.

product_name: Xiaomi Portable Mini Bluetooth Speaker Sound Pocket, Small Outdoor Best Wireless Blue Tooth Speaker 5.4 IP67 Waterproof with 10 Hours Playback Time, Supports TWS Connection, Black

reviews.review: Great value, surprisingly well built, portable and sounds great.  Need something easily packable I reckon this would be perfect.

This Xiaomi Mini has easily the best sound of any compact Bluetooth speaker I've used.  Sound is clear and balanced, and also surprisingly full for a speaker this size.  My tastes run towards new wave and power pop, and this speaker does a nice job with delicate acoustic guitar, plucked strings, and percussive synth notes, preserving the character of the music without allowing the individual instruments to blend into mush, which is what usually happens with speakers this small.Some people may not be satisfied with the level of bass--but the only way to deliver thumping bass without making the overall sound muddy is to have a woofer or sub-woofer separate from the main speaker reproducing the bulk of the instruments.  A speaker this size can deliver heavy bass or it can deliver a balanced sound, but it can't do both--for most music, balanced sound is far preferable.You can also answer phone calls with this speaker, but that's not something that I tested or have any interest in.With an IP 67 rating, this speaker can get wet without being damaged (which is why the product image shows splashing water surrounding the speaker).  The rating means the speaker can be submerged in water for 30 minutes, which is something else that I didn't personally test and really wouldn't recommend.  I did test water contact in the shower, and the speaker held up fine to that.Final Verdict:  For the price and size, this is a pretty amazing speaker.

I just got it and surprised me positively, the sound quality is great, specially considering the size of it.Super easy to pair, and just minutes after testing music I got a call and again very good quality.usi g it as an speaker for phone calls. I could hear the other person perfectly and they also heard me without issuesI definitely recommend it and it has a great price.

product_name: XIAOMI Portable Bluetooth Speaker Bluetooth 5.4, IP67 Wireless Speaker Waterproof with 12 Hours Playback Time, Supports TWS Connection (Blue)

reviews.review: I bought one a little over a year ago. It’s such a great portable speaker, I just bought a second one to take advantage of the stereo pairing option. Sound quality is amazing for such a small speaker. Working as a stereo pair, with eqMac for slight corrections in my home studio, they sound like an expensive pair of studio monitors.Very durable and serviceable too: my first one fell from the top of a shelf and the battery, and a connector came loose, not allowing it to charge and rattling with bass-heavy music. Long story short, with simple tools I was able to open it up, repair the damage, and put it back together.It’d be perfect if it had USB-C playback —or even a 3.5mm jack, but I don’t see why the whole thing can be hacked once the battery dies.
Very well built... Great quality and a good JBL Flip alternative...

Love it, very good sound.
Excelente opción, buen sonido, batería de larga duración, precio excelente.
Buen producto
Buena calidad para el precio
A very good speaker
Buenísimo

product_name: XIAOMI Redmi Watch 5 Active Smartwatch, 2.0" LCD Display, 18 Days of Battery Life, 140+ Sports Modes, 5ATM Waterproof, Bluetooth Calling, Fitness-Tracker- Matte Silver

reviews.review: Great smartwatch for the price! The screen is bright and clear, the battery lasts days, and it’s very comfortable to wear. Tracks steps, sleep, and workouts accurately. Simple, fast, and perfect for everyday use. Highly recommend!

I’ve always been a fan of Xiaomi products — I actually had two of their phones back before they became really popular. I don’t currently have one, but I might go back to Xiaomi after this experience. The Redmi Watch 5 is a nice and simple smartwatch for the price — you really can’t expect premium features when it’s not even $100, but it definitely holds its own.It does take a little time to get used to, especially figuring out how to unlock it, navigate the features, and connect it to the app on your phone. But once you get it set up, it works well and does what it’s supposed to. Overall, it’s a good, reliable watch for everyday use.
Ease of use, excellent quality and accuracy. The brightness is perfect and size too. Funcionality is better than my old smart watch.

The Redmi Watch 5 delivers an excellent balance of performance, design, and value. The display is bright and sharp, the tracking features are accurate, and the battery life easily lasts several days on a single charge. It feels premium on the wrist and performs flawlessly for daily use and workouts. Overall, a fantastic smartwatch for its price range.

The watch itself is very nice,  good size, battery life and features.  What I don't like is how or why I cannot get it to stop receiving my calls.  All of my phone calls while i m in and outside my car always default to going to this watch.  I have made some many changes but none worked.  My first option would be the car's audio,  and if i m not in the car,  I like using my speaker phone to talk.  But everything goes to the watch.  Even on my phone,  I would try to switch over to speaker phone,  car's audio,  but it wont' let me.
Good quality option. Only complaint about the little guy is with the belt. A little bit hard to tie but it fits very well

Very comfortable and easy to use. The battery lasts several days and the health and exercise functions work very well. The screen looks clear even in the sun. It exceeded my expectations, I totally recommend it.
It's very reliable. Works as stated

product_name: JBL Vibe Beam 2 - True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds with JBL Pure Bass Sound & Smart Ambient technology, 4mics for crisp, clear calls, up to 40Hrs of Playback, IP54 Dust & Water resistant (Black)

reviews.review: These JBL wireless earbuds have exceeded my expectations. The sound quality is clear and well-balanced, with strong bass that JBL is known for, without overpowering the mids and highs. They’re great for music, podcasts, and phone calls.The earbuds fit comfortably and stay in place, even during workouts or long listening sessions. Battery life has been solid, lasting through the day with the charging case providing extra power. Pairing was quick and easy, and the connection has been stable with no dropouts.Overall, these are high-quality wireless earbuds with great sound, comfort, and reliability. Definitely a great choice for everyday use.

After years of spending money on beats buds and air pods I am BLOWN AWAY at the affordability and quality of these earbuds! The sound is crisp, clear and loud and the fit is majorly comfy. I’m undecided on the quality of the microphone. In iMessage voice notes it suppresses too much and in other apps it sounds fine. Could be a setting in missing somewhere to adjust the noise suppression on the mic. Otherwise. AMAZING.

The battery durability is amazing long lasting it actually does cancel out noise and noisy surroundings and atmospheres the sound is clear the size of the product is as advertised easy to pair with any device and are better than my apple products well worth the price and a quality product very durable I love them they don't irritate your ears or hurt them they are very comfortable for long periods of time of wearing best earbuds on the market hands down and they don't hang up your calls or loose service your music 🎶 quality sound as well it's perfect for conference calls

Pros:Great headphones, sound is awesome, Bass is good. All of this is adjustable to some degree in the app. Fit is great, I use them at work, at the gym running, working out ect. Price is hard to beat.Cons:If you have the Noise Cancelling on i cannot get 8 hours of use before they need a charge. If you look carefully, just after the "40 hours of use" there is a note that this is if NC is off, that may be true, testing this now.Overall:Great earbuds. I love the JBL line and these for the cost are a great product.

These are really excellent for sound quality and have a good bass response. The only drawback (and it's a very small drawback) is the noise canceling is not quite as good as on my last pair of these. It's still acceptable though. For example, I have a soft top jeep and the ANC feature doesn't quite drown out the wind noise. To end the review these are an excellent product for the price point.
