I think if JBL addressed the fit (decrease the depth of the "body" in the ear so they seal better since there would be  less weight pulling down on the eartip) and eartips they'd have an extremely solid 50 dollar pair of earbuds.Controls -  ̶U̶n̶l̶e̶s̶s̶ ̶I̶'̶m̶ ̶m̶i̶s̶s̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶i̶t̶,̶ ̶I̶ ̶d̶i̶s̶l̶i̶k̶e̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶c̶o̶n̶t̶r̶o̶l̶s̶ ̶d̶o̶ ̶n̶o̶t̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶ ̶v̶o̶l̶u̶m̶e̶ ̶a̶d̶j̶u̶s̶t̶m̶e̶n̶t̶,̶ ̶m̶a̶s̶s̶i̶v̶e̶ ̶m̶i̶s̶p̶l̶a̶y̶ ̶f̶r̶o̶m̶ ̶J̶B̶L̶,̶ ̶l̶o̶o̶s̶e̶ ̶a̶ ̶s̶t̶a̶r̶ ̶f̶o̶r̶ ̶t̶h̶i̶s̶.̶ ̶I̶ ̶d̶o̶ ̶n̶o̶t̶ ̶w̶a̶n̶t̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶i̶n̶v̶o̶k̶e̶ ̶a̶n̶ ̶a̶s̶s̶i̶s̶t̶a̶n̶t̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶r̶a̶i̶s̶e̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶v̶o̶l̶u̶m̶e̶.̶ ̶T̶h̶e̶ ̶S̶o̶n̶y̶ ̶e̶a̶r̶b̶u̶d̶s̶ ̶d̶o̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶ ̶v̶o̶l̶u̶m̶e̶;̶ ̶h̶o̶w̶e̶v̶e̶r̶,̶ ̶  (UPDATE: Volume controls can be added through the app as a functionality; however, you loose the ability to change noise modes. I'm still rating 4 stars because I want both, would put 4.5 but can't. I don't see why both sides need a long press for google assistant or siri, one of these long presses could change the noise mode.) I would still pick the JBL buds because the volume steps are more gradual. I can get these to a comfortable level where with the Sony ones it always either a little too loud or a little too quiet. Other than volume I love that the controls are capacitive. Sony opted for actual push buttons in theirs which makes them unusable when laying on your side or for example working on your car, as you constantly bumping/pushing the buttons inadvertently in both cases -- so big win for the JBLs.Overall, a quality earbud for the price but improvements could be made, not sure you can find a more feature rich earbud for this price.

The JBL Tune 13ONC TWS earbuds deliver impressive audio quality with rich bass and clear mids. The Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) works well for blocking out ambient noise, making them great for commuting or working in busy environments.They fit comfortably and securely, with a compact, lightweight design. Battery life is solid, offering around 6 hours per charge plus additional charges from the case.The touch controls are intuitive and responsive, though sometimes a bit sensitive. Overall, they offer great value for wireless earbuds in this price range.Highly recommend for anyone looking for affordable ANC true wireless earbuds!

The sound quality is great. But the constant falling out, constant connection issues and troubleshooting (oh my god how much of my life I wasted getting these to reconnect), the not charging when I put them in the case, the constant pausing of my music because my hair touches the sensitive sensor while playing basketball. Just a headache that I constantly kept trying to ignore. I'm done with these. For casual listening, they are great. For active listening, heck no.

I had a refurbished pair of JBL Reflect Mini NC earbuds that died on me. So I bought these as a replacement. At the time I only paid 50 bucks because of a sale.Overall they are great at that price point. They are made out of plastic so they do feel a little cheap. But so far I have not had any issues with durability. The fit is surprisingly comfortable and they don’t slip out of my ear. Sound overall is solid. They have decent bass and a pretty balanced sound. Better than my old beats but not quite as clear as my previous JBL. Battery life is great for me, they have not died while using them. And the case holds an enough charge for a couple days, sometimes even a week.Overall, if I paid full price I wouldn’t be upset. The noise canceling helps but is not full cancellation. And they do not auto pause when I take them out of my ears. Both features I wish were better at a 100 price point.But for 50 bucks they have been excellent.

product_name: JBL Quantum TWS - True Wireless Noise Cancelling Gaming Earbuds, Fast Pair and JBL Dual Source, 6 beamforming mics, IPX4 Water Resistant, Up to 8hrs Playtime with 16hr of Backup in The case (Black)

reviews.review: First Thing: UPDATE these ear buds. You need to do it TWICE! Get the JBL app for your phone and software update the buds, then get the JBL Quantum Engine App for PC (or Mac) and do the firmware update. Before the updates I could only get one bud/channel to work with Android using the dongle, and after the updates both buds work. So far I have tested the USB-C Dongle with PC, Steam Deck, iPad, and Android - it works well with all devices listed providing low latency, and high(er) fidelity, sound. I tested multiple games on Steam Deck, including Hi-Fi Rush (a rhythm game), and had no latency issues. The Dongle is true plug and play (no setup needed) on every device except PC. Plugging in the USB-C Dongle prompted a download of Quantum Engine, and inside the QE app you can set EQ and tweak the Surround Sound settings. I tested the buds in Battlefield V on PC and the surround sound worked well. Adjusting the EQ in the QE app on PC is easy and necessary in order to get the most pleasing sound. The only device I’m using Bluetooth with is my Android phone and the sound is fine - use the JBL app to adjust the EQ. The Android App offers a FULL EQ, not the typical/lame EQ for dummies a lot of ear bud devices ship with.I’ve only had the JBL Quantum TWS Airs (that name lol) for a short time, so I can’t offer a comprehensive review yet. I will say they are very light and fit well in my ears. There is no wing, or stabilizer, so these might not be great for active on-the-go situations. The stock EQ needed a tweak for my ears, and the Apps make that easy. The sound quality via the USB-C Dongle is a noticeable upgrade in terms of latency and fidelity. These are better for music than I anticipated, and from reviews I read this is one of the big differences from the more expensive, and older version, of this line of Quantum TWS buds. Battery life is much shorter using the Dongle, and that makes sense as the low latency signal is more power hungry than Bluetooth. I spent some time looking for low latency wireless ear buds and this is one the most affordable options out there ($40 on sale). Hopefully in time more companies will offer similar low latency earbuds, or maybe Bluetooth will get good enough to make a product like this irrelevant.

Got these for $50 new in box marked as "used". The sound quality is great. I use them for the gym and for gaming. Im very competitive so im sensitive to latency and these have none that i can notice. They do get uncomfortable after long gaming sessions but most earbuds do that in my ears. Battery life could be better. They last around 4-5 hours with ANC enabled, with it off I'm not sure but definitely a lot longer than 5 hrs. They also look nice, not gamery or bulky.

They have an excellent sound quality, the ANC works pretty well and it's also adaptative, I'm not a fan of a talk-through function I think it's best to just pause your music.The headphones are pretty comfortable and fit perfectly for my ear, the battery life is very good too. The case is a little too big for carrying it on a pocket but still can fit. It charges pretty fast too and I appreciate that.The voice assistant is very useful, it can read and answer message and read u all your notifications. Also control smart home devices which I use a lot.Only problem with it is that the dongle doesn't work very well with other smartphones or tablets, I read that the Pc firmware update can fix that but my Pc doesn't have a usb-c port and I haven't been able to buy an adapter (and it can't connect to the pc app by Bluetooth for some reason).Definitely a good purchase still just for it's in-app customization, voice assistant features and sound quality.

So I bought these earbuds on discount for $75 on Black Friday, and I want to share some thoughts I have about this thing.1. It's not exactly perfectly low latency. I play rhythm games a lot, and I do notice a slight amount of latency even with the "low latency" dongle mode. I've tried disabling any audio processing on Windows, but it's still the same. The latency is fairly low given that it's wireless. You'll be hard pressed to notice for other games like Valorant, but there's just a touch of latency which prevents me from using it for rhythm games in particular.2. Audio is pretty good. Very bass heavy as you'd expect, but there is an EQ so you can change it around. Once you balance it out with the EQ I think the audio quality is quite exceptional for these buds.3. Battery life is mid. When you use it in low-latency mode the battery dies in around 3-4 hours without ANC or processing. Probably take off an hour if you had it on. The bluetooth mode lasts for much longer, I'd peg it around 6 hours (although I've never fully drained it in bluetooth yet).4. Charging is fairly fast for both the case and the earbuds.5. There are some strange audio artifacts (glitching and occasionally choppy audio) with the dongle. This happens very occasionally, and I've tried disabling interference like from Wi-Fi and other 2.4Ghz accessories but it still occurs.6. I think the touch controls are hard to learn. The one for switching modes is fairly straightforward, but pairing, switching, and learning play/pause is not intuitive.7. Noise cancellation is quite weak compared to many other earbuds on the market, similar with the "transparency mode" on these things. Talk-thru actually is OK, but sounds artificial and you can definitely tell the noise from outside is piped in.8. They sit comfortably in the ears and don't feel like they're gonna fall out. However, at least for me, they get uncomfortable over like 1 hour of wearing.Overall, given the discounted $75 price I think they're a great pair of buds, better than other $99 Bluetooth buds on the market. At the original $150, there are much better options (without low latency dongle).And gamers beware, if you are planning to use these for latency critical audio tasks, these are NOT for you. Stick to wired or look for something else. These get quite close but I still notice a tad bit of audio latency.

product_name: JBL Live Pro 2 - True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds, up to 40 Hours of Playback with Wireless Charging, 6 mics for Perfect Calls, Touch & Voice Control, IPX5 Water Resistant (Black)

reviews.review: Amazing sound with high quality low-high drivers on these JBL's. Noise cancelling is best in class for these earbuds, and the pass-through mode for still hearing conversation with them in works very well.They last FOREVER. I work 12 hour shifts and can easily get through a shift with the bud in my right ear all day. Over my hour lunch break I put it back in the case and that charge is enough to get me through an entire day with no interruptions. In my experience the advertised 40 total hours of listening with the charging case is very accurate. I measured it at 38.5 hours with the volume set to about 80-85%. I'm sure you could easily get 40+ hours if using them at 50% volume.The charging case is great, feels very high quality. Charges wirelessly on a charging pad or with USBC input. Charges very quickly, roughly 1.5-2 hours for a full charge if you are charging them with a low volt charger as you are supposed to as not to damage the internal battery.*NOTE* please people, don't charge any of your earbuds of any brand with a 100 watt fast charger, you will damage the battery over time I promise.The JBL app is one of the best earbud companion apps I've used. It blows the BEATS app out of the water and is much better than the majority of its competition. You can change EQ, noise cancelling, and touch control programming quickly and easily.Speaking of touch controls, they are located on the stem of each bud and work very reliably in my experience. 1 tap for pause, 2 taps for skip ahead, 1 tap hold for voice assistant. 2 taps then hold on the 2nd tap for pairing mode. Haven't had any issues with accidental touches over the last 6+ months of using them every day.The sound profile is rich and deep, with these high quality drivers after Harmon kardon joined with JBL, they are much more well rounded than anything else in the 150 dollar range. Highs are crisp and satisfying and lows have a great little rumble without muddling the mids. Soundstage isnt too open like you get with some of the partial In ear designs but doesn't feel closed off and stuffy either. My father in law was an audio engineer in Hollywood for 40 years and worked for almost every major band under the sun as well as the Jimmy Kimmel show for many years, and when he tried these out on our last visit he was genuinely impressed. He is normally a Sony or Bose guy but expressed interest in buying a pair of these for around the house.As far as fitment goes, I go with the middle sized silicone tips and they work great for me. There are small, medium and large tips that come in the package. They are more comfortable than the beats I have and far more comfortable than my airpods pro. I can use them for 12 hours straight without ear fatigue. They are ported enough where they don't feel stuffy in my ears and don't make my ears itchy like most other buds do after only a couple of hours.Overall, I highly recommend these earbuds from JBL. They are the best value for money in this price range--bar none. I would take these all day everyday over my airpods pro and that's saying something as those are no slouch either. If you are on the fence about these, I'd advise you to just buy them and see for yourself. As someone who uses earbuds for 12 hours a day, 48 hours a week, these are my go-to buds and I've tried at least 20 other models from all the major brands.

These are my favorite JBL earphones I’ve had! They’re even better when you use the JBL app to customize your hearing experience. The noise cancellation feature is 10/10 & I love the wireless charging capability. The charging case is compact & lightweight. They’re better than Apple Beats & more affordable. Although I wish the pink ones were overnight-able, the black ones I purchased are still aesthetically pleasing.

I bought these to replace a set of Airpods of which the battery life was quickly becoming abysmal. The purpose of the headphones was convenience. They are kept on the table beside my chair in the living room. They are easy to get to when I want to listen to something like a youtube video and not have wires so I'm not tethered to my device if I need to get up to the let the dog out. The best thing about the airpods is they were made so they don't plug into my ear canal. Most ear buds just work their way out of my ear canals so not having that issue was a major plus. Since they are dying I decided to see what else would fill that role that would have better battery life. I looked for ratings and advice on the Internet. These JBLs seemed to be what I needed for the same price as a new set of basic Airpods. The only negative was they have tips that fit into ear canals. Since the rest of the ear bud looked like it would sit in the outer ear almost like the Airpods I decided to risk it. I had to put the smallest tips on them to get them in my ear canals. The left one slowly works it's way out over time unless I really push it in deep but it hasn't been a big issue. They are very comfortable. The sound quality is very nice. Being able to customize the EQ in the app was really great so I could tailor the sound to my liking. These aren't audiophile quality but I would hope that wouldn't be expected at this price point. They pair up with my Ipad immediately every time. I have done any extended listening but the battery life has been great. It's very convenient to be able to put the case on a charging pad instead of having to plug it in. The noise cancellation works pretty good in my opinion. I don't have anything else with noise cancelling to compare it to. I do find it funny that it blocks most of the sound from the tv but when my wife talks to me I can hear her at a significantly reduced level but still fairly clearly. Noise cancellation isn't important to me so I leave it off almost all the time in favor of increased battery life. The most important thing I can say is if I was in the market to buy another set of wireless ear buds, I'd buy these again with no hesitation as long as the reason I was looking for another set wasn't because these stopped working in a short period of time.

As someone who uses earbuds for 12 hours a day, 48 hours a week, these are my go-to buds and I've tried at least 20 other models from all the major brands.

These are my favorite JBL earphones I’ve had! They’re even better when you use the JBL app to customize your hearing experience. The noise cancellation feature is 10/10 & I love the wireless charging capability. The charging case is compact & lightweight. They’re better than Apple Beats & more affordable. Although I wish the pink ones were overnight-able, the black ones I purchased are still aesthetically pleasing.

I bought these to replace a set of Airpods of which the battery life was quickly becoming abysmal. The purpose of the headphones was convenience. They are kept on the table beside my chair in the living room. They are easy to get to when I want to listen to something like a youtube video and not have wires so I'm not tethered to my device if I need to get up to the let the dog out. The best thing about the airpods is they were made so they don't plug into my ear canal. Most ear buds just work their way out of my ear canals so not having that issue was a major plus. Since they are dying I decided to see what else would fill that role that would have better battery life. I looked for ratings and advice on the Internet. These JBLs seemed to be what I needed for the same price as a new set of basic Airpods. The only negative was they have tips that fit into ear canals. Since the rest of the ear bud looked like it would sit in the outer ear almost like the Airpods I decided to risk it. I had to put the smallest tips on them to get them in my ear canals. The left one slowly works it's way out over time unless I really push it in deep but it hasn't been a big issue. They are very comfortable. The sound quality is very nice. Being able to customize the EQ in the app was really great so I could tailor the sound to my liking. These aren't audiophile quality but I would hope that wouldn't be expected at this price point. They pair up with my Ipad immediately every time. I have done any extended listening but the battery life has been great. It's very convenient to be able to put the case on a charging pad instead of having to plug it in. The noise cancellation works pretty good in my opinion. I don't have anything else with noise cancelling to compare it to. I do find it funny that it blocks most of the sound from the tv but when my wife talks to me I can hear her at a significantly reduced level but still fairly clearly. Noise cancellation isn't important to me so I leave it off almost all the time in favor of increased battery life. The most important thing I can say is if I was in the market to buy another set of wireless ear buds, I'd buy these again with no hesitation as long as the reason I was looking for another set wasn't because these stopped working in a short period of time.

Highs are crisp and satisfying and lows have a great little rumble without muddling the mids. Soundstage isnt too open like you get with some of the partial In ear designs but doesn't feel closed off and stuffy either. My father in law was an audio engineer in Hollywood for 40 years and worked for almost every major band under the sun as well as the Jimmy Kimmel show for many years, and when he tried these out on our last visit he was genuinely impressed. He is normally a Sony or Bose guy but expressed interest in buying a pair of these for around the house.As far as fitment goes, I go with the middle sized silicone tips and they work great for me. There are small, medium and large tips that come in the package. They are more comfortable than the beats I have and far more comfortable than my airpods pro. I can use them for 12 hours straight without ear fatigue. They are ported enough where they don't feel stuffy in my ears and don't make my ears itchy like most other buds do after only a couple of hours.Overall, I highly recommend these earbuds from JBL. They are the best value for money in this price range--bar none. I would take these all day everyday over my airpods pro and that's saying something as those are no slouch either. If you are on the fence about these, I'd advise you to just buy them and see for yourself. As someone who uses earbuds for 12 hours a day, 48 hours a week, these are my go-to buds and I've tried at least 20 other models from all the major brands.

These are my favorite JBL earphones I’ve had! They’re even better when you use the JBL app to customize your hearing experience. The noise cancellation feature is 10/10 & I love the wireless charging capability. The charging case is compact & lightweight. They’re better than Apple Beats & more affordable. Although I wish the pink ones were overnight-able, the black ones I purchased are still aesthetically pleasing.

I bought these to replace a set of Airpods of which the battery life was quickly becoming abysmal. The purpose of the headphones was convenience. They are kept on the table beside my chair in the living room. They are easy to get to when I want to listen to something like a youtube video and not have wires so I'm not tethered to my device if I need to get up to the let the dog out. The best thing about the airpods is they were made so they don't plug into my ear canal. Most ear buds just work their way out of my ear canals so not having that issue was a major plus. Since they are dying I decided to see what else would fill that role that would have better battery life. I looked for ratings and advice on the Internet. These JBLs seemed to be what I needed for the same price as a new set of basic Airpods. The only negative was they have tips that fit into ear canals. Since the rest of the ear bud looked like it would sit in the outer ear almost like the Airpods I decided to risk it. I had to put the smallest tips on them to get them in my ear canals. The left one slowly works it's way out over time unless I really push it in deep but it hasn't been a big issue. They are very comfortable. The sound quality is very nice. Being able to customize the EQ in the app was really great so I could tailor the sound to my liking. These aren't audiophile quality but I would hope that wouldn't be expected at this price point. They pair up with my Ipad immediately every time. I have done any extended listening but the battery life has been great. It's very convenient to be able to put the case on a charging pad instead of having to plug it in. The noise cancellation works pretty good in my opinion. I don't have anything else with noise cancelling to compare it to. I do find it funny that it blocks most of the sound from the tv but when my wife talks to me I can hear her at a significantly reduced level but still fairly clearly. Noise cancellation isn't important to me so I leave it off almost all the time in favor of increased battery life. The most important thing I can say is if I was in the market to buy another set of wireless ear buds, I'd buy these again with no hesitation as long as the reason I was looking for another set wasn't because these stopped working in a short period of time.

product_name: JBL VIBE 100 TWS - True Wireless In-Ear Headphones - Black

reviews.review: Love them. Good sound quality. Can't even remember when I bought them, I've had them for so long. Comfortable for small ears. Have worn in light rain and still sound great. Easy bluetooth connection. Simple control settings. Hold charge for a long time. Worth every penny.
Very good earbuds. Good quality nice bass, very comfortable and durable.

Have been using this for many years now(6 years atleast) for it works very well. It stays on when I go on my walks and I like the color. It is easy to connect and automatically connects to your phone/device when you turn it on. The sound is also nice but it does not have noise cancelation. It is very durable and good value for money. The only downside is that battery does not last long time so you have to charge it more frequently than otber earbuds.

So far no complaints..Stay in my ear usually...better than most ..They have fantastic sound and stay charged for several hours.P.s. seems to be my cats favorite toy. Especially with sound on ..those vibrations just set her wild !
Great quality, sound and long lasting.

All in all I'm not disappointed in purchasing these and I'm not going to tell you to not buy them but just know you kind of get what you pay for The fitment though I know it's subjective at least in my case is not very comfortable especially in my left ear they feel rather sharp like they're cutting into my ears.The volume isn't very loud probably loud enough for most people but I like my music a little louder these are not audio file headphones but they are kind of fun to listen to they've got the bog standard Bluetooth headphones equalizer setup heavy base The mids are toned down quite a bit and enough treble. Bottom line they work fine for activities like mowing the lawn waiting for a bus to arrive or canceling out loud noise during demo work I've actually used them as earplugs a couple of times they're not waterproof.Dropping them more than not ends up with one of the headphones flying across the floor as there is no lid on the case I get it it's part of the design but it's a little annoying I find that the case will only charge them about 1 and 1/2 times before the case is dead which can be a little annoying as well I do like the type c charger port on the case but other than that they're pretty much the bog standard cheap earbuds we've all come to know.One final thing again this might just be my weird ears but they don't seem to stay in very well especially the left ear.
Really good quality for price.
Even tho I only had these for a month before I lost the case.  These were good.  Sound was good.  When answering phone calls it was clear.

product_name: JBL Vibe Buds - True Wireless Earbuds, Smart Ambient, VoiceAware, Up to 32 total hours of battery life with speed charging, Water and dust resistant, JBL Deep Bass Sound (Black)

reviews.review: The headphones fit perfectly while also having really good bass and sound quality. But out of the box the sound is a little funky but after 5 minutes of use it returns back to normal and while getting really good sound quality and also have slot of battery life. I have been using them all day and it only got to around 80 percent on the JBL APP

I had to write this review after losing my old iOS Pro Buds and needing a new pair. These JBL Vibe Buds were on sale for $30, and I expected just okay for the price. But they’re amazing value. JBL has built solid products for years, and these are no exception. For $30, the sound is fantastic, and they stay in my ears without any issue—the default fit out of the box was perfect, and they arrived fully charged.The QR code for the JBL app is a nice touch, offering easy access to different sound settings. I’m an AI music creator, and these buds deliver some of the best sound I’ve heard, even compared to more expensive options.If I ever lose them again, I’ll definitely be buying another pair. Highly recommended

These work great, sound good, link up to Bluetooth easily.  But if you have them in your pocket or backpack and they separate from the charger, they can run out of battery, get lost or dirty.  I would highly recommend these for casual use.

These are eliteee, so basically yall im a gym girly and i usually go to the gym with my airpod pros but i left them somewhere and for someone who listens to music at work and etc i need to replace them quick, these are better than airpods!!! Bass is great, sound is clean, and they’re LOUD 10/10 get them also they dont have a top so that’s weird

This product is exceptionally excellent,  ive had this exactly a year to this date, amd ive had this in the toughest weather condition possible, and still functioning as new, great quality sound, I mean this things is excellent.  Love this high recommend this over any apple pods

DO NOT BUY THESE.These have been a problem from the start. The first pair I got, the audio squeaked and dropped every few seconds. They would barely work with Apple products, and they'd work okay with Microsoft products. I submitted for an exchange or refund WITHIN DAYS OF RECEIVING THEM, and Amazon rejected both. I then contacted JBL and started the process over. I very clearly explained that I had done all of the trouble shooting possible. I was told to try the troubleshooting again, as there was no other option. I told them I wasn't going to waste my time, and that they needed to make it right. I got no reply.A week later I got an email requesting a review of my service, HILARIOUS. I let them know I received a defective product and was ignored by both Amazon and JBL. I told them you're welcome for the free money.I immediately got a reply apologizing and information to return the defective products, as well as a tracking number for the replacement pair.Unfortunately, the new pair has the same issues, although not as severely. I decided to keep them because wasn't interesting in spending more time begging to get what I'm owed. Aside from the audio issues, the casing on these have begun to chip off. These headphones sit on my desk all day. They do not get jostled inside of a bag or moved around whatsoever.I've had these second pair almost a year, and now they work even less then the original pair did. I'm going to go to the gas station and buy a $5 pair, drive over them with my car a few times, and they'll still sound better and be more durable than these earbuds ever did.JBL, I never wanted to talk to you again, but you're about to hear from me. (Make sure you're not wearing the Vibe Buds!!)

For the price these are good. However, after a year of use, I noticed noticed bluetooth audio cutting out periodically which is frustrating and ruins music listening. Despite this, I would still recommend these.P.S buy a case!!! The JBL Vibe Buds case has some fragile corners that chip over time.

For the price, these are great. I like to keep a pair of headphones by my bed to listen to audiobooks or music in bed. I had to replace an old pair of airpods because they wouldn’t hold a charge longer than 30 minutes. My primary focus was battery life. I fall asleep with these JBLs in and in the morning they still have at least half battery after sitting out of the case all night long. Second want for ear buds was something better at noise canceling than airpods (husband snores). These are exceptional at noise cancelling and you don’t have to turn the volume up super loud to achieve it. Only complaint, and this is totally my fault, is that the rubber tips are slightly too large for my ears and they fall out a lot or make my ears sore. But they came with either replacement rubber tips or different sizes in the box when i got them and i threw them away. Since then ive been having a hard time finding generic replacement tips that don’t disrupt the charging on these. But like i said that’s on me. Anyways TL:DR baby best the price, excellent battery life, above average noise cancelling.

I had to write this review after losing my old iOS Pro Buds and needing a new pair. These JBL Vibe Buds were on sale for $30, and I expected just okay for the price. But they’re amazing value. JBL has built solid products for years, and these are no exception. For $30, the sound is fantastic, and they stay in my ears without any issue—the default fit out of the box was perfect, and they arrived fully charged.The QR code for the JBL app is a nice touch, offering easy access to different sound settings. I’m an AI music creator, and these buds deliver some of the best sound I’ve heard, even compared to more expensive options.If I ever lose them again, I’ll definitely be buying another pair. Highly recommended

These work great, sound good, link up to Bluetooth easily.  But if you have them in your pocket or backpack and they separate from the charger, they can run out of battery, get lost or dirty.  I would highly recommend these for casual use.

These are eliteee, so basically yall im a gym girly and i usually go to the gym with my airpod pros but i left them somewhere and for someone who listens to music at work and etc i need to replace them quick, these are better than airpods!!! Bass is great, sound is clean, and they’re LOUD 10/10 get them also they dont have a top so that’s weird

This product is exceptionally excellent,  ive had this exactly a year to this date, amd ive had this in the toughest weather condition possible, and still functioning as new, great quality sound, I mean this things is excellent.  Love this high recommend this over any apple pods

DO NOT BUY THESE.These have been a problem from the start. The first pair I got, the audio squeaked and dropped every few seconds. They would barely work with Apple products, and they'd work okay with Microsoft products. I submitted for an exchange or refund WITHIN DAYS OF RECEIVING THEM, and Amazon rejected both. I then contacted JBL and started the process over. I very clearly explained that I had done all of the trouble shooting possible. I was told to try the troubleshooting again, as there was no other option. I told them I wasn't going to waste my time, and that they needed to make it right. I got no reply.A week later I got an email requesting a review of my service, HILARIOUS. I let them know I received a defective product and was ignored by both Amazon and JBL. I told them you're welcome for the free money.I immediately got a reply apologizing and information to return the defective products, as well as a tracking number for the replacement pair.Unfortunately, the new pair has the same issues, although not as severely. I decided to keep them because wasn't interesting in spending more time begging to get what I'm owed. Aside from the audio issues, the casing on these have begun to chip off. These headphones sit on my desk all day. They do not get jostled inside of a bag or moved around whatsoever.I've had these second pair almost a year, and now they work even less then the original pair did. I'm going to go to the gas station and buy a $5 pair, drive over them with my car a few times, and they'll still sound better and be more durable than these earbuds ever did.JBL, I never wanted to talk to you again, but you're about to hear from me. (Make sure you're not wearing the Vibe Buds!!)

For the price these are good. However, after a year of use, I noticed noticed bluetooth audio cutting out periodically which is frustrating and ruins music listening. Despite this, I would still recommend these.P.S buy a case!!! The JBL Vibe Buds case has some fragile corners that chip over time.

For the price, these are great. I like to keep a pair of headphones by my bed to listen to audiobooks or music in bed. I had to replace an old pair of airpods because they wouldn’t hold a charge longer than 30 minutes. My primary focus was battery life. I fall asleep with these JBLs in and in the morning they still have at least half battery after sitting out of the case all night long. Second want for ear buds was something better at noise canceling than airpods (husband snores). These are exceptional at noise cancelling and you don’t have to turn the volume up super loud to achieve it. Only complaint, and this is totally my fault, is that the rubber tips are slightly too large for my ears and they fall out a lot or make my ears sore. But they came with either replacement rubber tips or different sizes in the box when i got them and i threw them away. Since then ive been having a hard time finding generic replacement tips that don’t disrupt the charging on these. But like i said that’s on me. Anyways TL:DR baby best the price, excellent battery life, above average noise cancelling.

product_name: JLab Go Air Pop+ True Wireless Earbuds, in Ear Headphones, Bluetooth Earphones, 35H Playtime Ear Buds, Bluetooth Earbuds with Microphone, USB-C Charging Case, Dual Connect, EQ3 Sound, Black

reviews.review: The JLab Go Air Pop+ true wireless earbuds offer a solid balance between affordability and performance. They feature Bluetooth connectivity, a built-in microphone, and up to 35 hours of total battery life with the USB-C charging case. The earbuds deliver customizable EQ3 sound settings and dual connection support, making them convenient for everyday use. With a comfortable in-ear design, stylish color options, and a high customer rating, they are a reliable choice for users looking for quality wireless earbuds at a reasonable price.

...i don't know how these are only $20.  the sound quality is great for the price, but even more broadly, the VALUE IS THERE!  i have used exclusively airpods for the last five or so years, so much so that i kinda forgot that other options exist.  i was here, with one broken airpod (thanks to my dog--he's a good boy who doesn't chew on things but decided my airpod that unknowingly fell out of my pocket looked tasty, i guess?).  this stuck me only using the left one while i "saved up" somehow--during the holidays--for a new pair of pros.  after a week or two of using the one, it kinda dawned on me that, wait, there's more out there than just airpods lol.  my man watches a ton of tech stuff on youtube, so it's not like i was unaware, it just didn't click FOR ME that there is more out there that i could actually use!  once he turned me into an Apple girlie, i said there was no going back.  and we all know nothing works as well with Apple than more Apple, right?  it's true; the immediate connectivity and seamless pairing of airpods is unmatched.  i won't sit and pretend that's not true.  but these are a close second, as far as i can tell.  i don't listen to music at home very often, especially not in earbuds; i'm usually listening to news, podcasts, reactions, etc.  so i'm not looking for amazing sound quality by any means.  BUT THESE HAVE IT!  i put on TPAB to check and YEAH, THESE ARE GREAT!  the familiar songs i know so well weren't lost to some cheap engineering or budget components.  but for my normal use case scenario--listening to political news on a low volume while i'm working from home, listening to hip-hop media while cleaning the kitchen, or listening to reddit stories to drown out my man's snoring on those extra-loud nights, these are phenomenal.  also EXTREMELY comfortable.  i love the skin-tones they came out with, too.  that's so frickin cute and thoughtful that i had to get a pair in my own skintone even though i'm more of a white/black girlie.  it's so nice to have them blend in rather than be this white, obvious thing in my ear.  i LOVE the app--it shows the battery level, lets you check for updates MANUALLY, but also has an equalizer, CUSTOM TOUCH CONTROLS!!!!!!!!! which i of course used to mimic the touch control of airpods just for ease of use, allows you to even set a volume limit to protect your ears.  also comes with some built-in ambient noises which i am a big fan of.  and the awareness feature -- i am assuming this is maybe for people who go on walks???  or, like me, wear them a lot but still have conversations here and there.  i'm so super impressed with these LITERALLY TWENTY DOLLAR earbuds, i can't say it enough!!!i want to state that i am in no way compensated for this review, nor is this one of the increasingly-common AI-generated reviews you'll see on this platform, i am just genuinely so surprised by the quality and the comfort of these.  i think these are an amazing, affordable option for anyone who is ready to burst out of their expensive Apple comfort zone, or on a budget trying to save up for something they think is "nicer" (trust me...you might change your mind on that part).  these would make a wonderful gift for teens who lose things (i know all too well), or even just to have around as a backup pair.  if i were still working in an office, i'd probably buy another to keep in my desk.  they're THAT GOOD.still TBD is how well they work with a PC -- i've only used them with my phone, so far.  if i decide to try that out, i'll come back to update :)

I bought this pair of earbuds on sale for a very reasonable price, thinking that if it does not work out as expected, I would not be too upset about it.  But to my surprise, this pair of earbuds works really well, and the sound quality is solid.  The earbuds pack with operating features that are responsive.  The device connects to my phone right away and stay connected throughout my workout.  The pair of earbuds feel relatively comfortable to wear and fits snuggly in my ear canal.  The device stayed securely in my ears most of my workout routine, but there were a few occasions I had to adjust the fitting as I felt the device slipping out of ear.  I find it useful that the device comes with a very short built-in usb-c female charging cable that tucks underneath the charging case where I do not need to carry around a charging cable and comes with multiple silicone ear tips to make the device fit to my ear canal size.  I also like the "aware" feature that amplifies the surrounding sounds to make me aware of what is around me, especially when I am riding a bike on a busy street.  One thing I was not too thrilled about was the effort it takes to remove the earpiece out of the case.  Some reason I had hard time getting a good grip on the earpiece to remove it out of box, especially when the two earpieces are together in the case.  Perhaps it is my poor grip or the slippery material of the earpiece, but it took a lot more effort than I expected to remove the earpieces.  Other than that, this product offers good quality sound at a reasonable price.  The question is... how long the battery will last....

I’ve been using the JLab Go Air Pop+ earbuds for about two months now, and overall I’m really impressed with what you get for the price.First off, the sound quality is very decent for budget true wireless earbuds. They’re not meant to compete with premium models, but for everyday listening—music, videos, and calls—they sound clear and punchy. The EQ3 settings are a nice bonus and actually make a noticeable difference depending on what you’re listening to. The mic is not bad.. whoever I'm talking to can hear me but there's no noise canceling at all which can be annoying if you're in a noisy environment.Battery life is another strong point. I don’t find myself charging these often, and they easily last through multiple days of casual use. The dual connect feature is convenient too, especially if you want to use just one earbud at a time.There’s no active noise canceling, but that’s expected at this price point, and honestly I didn’t miss it. Passive isolation is fine for normal use.My only minor complaint is the built-in USB-C charging cable. It works, but it’s a bit annoying having to plug the case directly into an adapter instead of using a separate cable. Not a dealbreaker, just something to be aware of. Also the touch controls are a bit finicky and you have to learn the gestures for left and right buds separately.Overall, these are a great option if you’re looking for affordable, reliable earbuds with good sound and excellent battery life. I’d definitely recommend them to anyone who wants solid performance without spending a lot.

...i don't know how these are only $20.  the sound quality is great for the price, but even more broadly, the VALUE IS THERE!  i have used exclusively airpods for the last five or so years, so much so that i kinda forgot that other options exist.  i was here, with one broken airpod (thanks to my dog--he's a good boy who doesn't chew on things but decided my airpod that unknowingly fell out of my pocket looked tasty, i guess?).  this stuck me only using the left one while i "saved up" somehow--during the holidays--for a new pair of pros.  after a week or two of using the one, it kinda dawned on me that, wait, there's more out there than just airpods lol.  my man watches a ton of tech stuff on youtube, so it's not like i was unaware, it just didn't click FOR ME that there is more out there that i could actually use!  once he turned me into an Apple girlie, i said there was no going back.  and we all know nothing works as well with Apple than more Apple, right?  it's true; the immediate connectivity and seamless pairing of airpods is unmatched.  i won't sit and pretend that's not true.  but these are a close second, as far as i can tell.  i don't listen to music at home very often, especially not in earbuds; i'm usually listening to news, podcasts, reactions, etc.  so i'm not looking for amazing sound quality by any means.  BUT THESE HAVE IT!  i put on TPAB to check and YEAH, THESE ARE GREAT!  the familiar songs i know so well weren't lost to some cheap engineering or budget components.  but for my normal use case scenario--listening to political news on a low volume while i'm working from home, listening to hip-hop media while cleaning the kitchen, or listening to reddit stories to drown out my man's snoring on those extra-loud nights, these are phenomenal.  also EXTREMELY comfortable.  i love the skin-tones they came out with, too.  that's so frickin cute and thoughtful that i had to get a pair in my own skintone even though i'm more of a white/black girlie.  it's so nice to have them blend in rather than be this white, obvious thing in my ear.  i LOVE the app--it shows the battery level, lets you check for updates MANUALLY, but also has an equalizer, CUSTOM TOUCH CONTROLS!!!!!!!!! which i of course used to mimic the touch control of airpods just for ease of use, allows you to even set a volume limit to protect your ears.  also comes with some built-in ambient noises which i am a big fan of.  and the awareness feature -- i am assuming this is maybe for people who go on walks???  or, like me, wear them a lot but still have conversations here and there.  i'm so super impressed with these LITERALLY TWENTY DOLLAR earbuds, i can't say it enough!!!i want to state that i am in no way compensated for this review, nor is this one of the increasingly-common AI-generated reviews you'll see on this platform, i am just genuinely so surprised by the quality and the comfort of these.  i think these are an amazing, affordable option for anyone who is ready to burst out of their expensive Apple comfort zone, or on a budget trying to save up for something they think is "nicer" (trust me...you might change your mind on that part).  these would make a wonderful gift for teens who lose things (i know all too well), or even just to have around as a backup pair.  if i were still working in an office, i'd probably buy another to keep in my desk.  they're THAT GOOD.still TBD is how well they work with a PC -- i've only used them with my phone, so far.  if i decide to try that out, i'll come back to update :)

I bought this pair of earbuds on sale for a very reasonable price, thinking that if it does not work out as expected, I would not be too upset about it.  But to my surprise, this pair of earbuds works really well, and the sound quality is solid.  The earbuds pack with operating features that are responsive.  The device connects to my phone right away and stay connected throughout my workout.  The pair of earbuds feel relatively comfortable to wear and fits snuggly in my ear canal.  The device stayed securely in my ears most of my workout routine, but there were a few occasions I had to adjust the fitting as I felt the device slipping out of ear.  I find it useful that the device comes with a very short built-in usb-c female charging cable that tucks underneath the charging case where I do not need to carry around a charging cable and comes with multiple silicone ear tips to make the device fit to my ear canal size.  I also like the "aware" feature that amplifies the surrounding sounds to make me aware of what is around me, especially when I am riding a bike on a busy street.  One thing I was not too thrilled about was the effort it takes to remove the earpiece out of the case.  Some reason I had hard time getting a good grip on the earpiece to remove it out of box, especially when the two earpieces are together in the case.  Perhaps it is my poor grip or the slippery material of the earpiece, but it took a lot more effort than I expected to remove the earpieces.  Other than that, this product offers good quality sound at a reasonable price.  The question is... how long the battery will last....

I’ve been using the JLab Go Air Pop+ earbuds for about two months now, and overall I’m really impressed with what you get for the price.First off, the sound quality is very decent for budget true wireless earbuds. They’re not meant to compete with premium models, but for everyday listening—music, videos, and calls—they sound clear and punchy. The EQ3 settings are a nice bonus and actually make a noticeable difference depending on what you’re listening to. The mic is not bad.. whoever I'm talking to can hear me but there's no noise canceling at all which can be annoying if you're in a noisy environment.Battery life is another strong point. I don’t find myself charging these often, and they easily last through multiple days of casual use. The dual connect feature is convenient too, especially if you want to use just one earbud at a time.There’s no active noise canceling, but that’s expected at this price point, and honestly I didn’t miss it. Passive isolation is fine for normal use.My only minor complaint is the built-in USB-C charging cable. It works, but it’s a bit annoying having to plug the case directly into an adapter instead of using a separate cable. Not a dealbreaker, just something to be aware of. Also the touch controls are a bit finicky and you have to learn the gestures for left and right buds separately.Overall, these are a great option if you’re looking for affordable, reliable earbuds with good sound and excellent battery life. I’d definitely recommend them to anyone who wants solid performance without spending a lot.

product_name: JLab Go Air Pop+ True Wireless Earbuds, in Ear Headphones, Bluetooth Earphones, 35H Playtime Ear Buds, Bluetooth Earbuds with Microphone, USB-C Charging Case, Dual Connect, EQ3 Sound, Black

reviews.review: The JLab Go Air Pop+ true wireless earbuds offer a solid balance between affordability and performance. They feature Bluetooth connectivity, a built-in microphone, and up to 35 hours of total battery life with the USB-C charging case. The earbuds deliver customizable EQ3 sound settings and dual connection support, making them convenient for everyday use. With a comfortable in-ear design, stylish color options, and a high customer rating, they are a reliable choice for users looking for quality wireless earbuds at a reasonable price.

product_name: JBL Tour PRO+ TWS True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, up to 32H Battery, 3 mics, Wireless Charging, Google Assistant and Alexa Built-in (Black)

reviews.review: These started out at $200, I waited and waited and got them for $100. Worth the wait. These are high-end earbuds for sure. As high end as Bluetooth can be anyway. I believe they are now back up to $200.Initially, when I first used them, the sound seemed low for the sound level I'm accustomed to on other earbuds. But as my ears acclimated to them...or possibly the earbuds burned in...the sound became more involved and I can hear a wider soundstage than with other earbuds.Overall sound is clean, crisp and clear. The bass is strong if you have and can maintain a sufficiently tight seal in the ear. The stock eartips didn't provide a reliable seal so I installed the largest eartips I have from my Panasonic RZ-S500W earbuds. That did the trick. Reliable seal and they fit in the JBL charging case.The charging case is a little on the large side, but it's still okay. Excellent build quality. Battery life so far on the buds and case are great. But I rarely use earbuds longer than 3 hours so BL isn't much of a concern to me.For reference, I have or have had the earbuds listed below. I will say that I am favoring these JBL earbuds over all of them but my Master & Dynamic MW-07. But I grab these more often because the M&D earbuds don't last more than 2.5 hours battery life. And at about 1.5 hours they produce a warning sound that repeats every so often. Nevertheless, the M&D sound quality is among the best I've ever heard.[Ranked ONLY for sound quality from best to worst]Master & Dynamic MW-07Technics EAH-AZ70W (Best ANC and exceptional sound quality, but battery depletes while powered off)JBL Tour PRO+Technics EAH-AZ60Sony WF-1000XM4 (Bought for "World leading ANC". Returned. Their ANC wasn't better than the Technics EAH-AZ70W and their sound wasn't exceptional enough)Sony LinkBuds SJBL Live FreeNC+ (very small, nicely compact case, but limited custom eartip selection that will fit in the case)Moondrop SparksPanasonic RZ-S500WSennheiser CXSennheiser CX 400BT

I have been very eager to try these, and after losing my beloved Samsung pros, I decided I had to buy! Comparatively on price, these match to many top name brand earbuds on the market, however they blow the competition out of the water! Other than a having a hard time finding a comfortable fitment for my smaller ears, as these buds are bigger than most, the pros of this product outweigh everything negative by miles!The sound quality is unparalleled for the price, with an insane immersive audio, that can be fully adjusted and controlled from the app!The easy to operate touch controls are not overly sensitive, preventing that annoying accidental command. Battery will last longer than my phone, and working in a factory setting, I keep them in for the noise canceling all day without recharge.Currently looking for a protector case, similar to my samsung pros waterproof case, as the charging case does seem a bit brittle like all others, but that doesn't mean anything! I will be back with an update on the charging case.
Good sound.  Prone to getting plugged with ear wax, and that’s not a normal problem for me.  Have been using for several years.
I like the earbuds, however they are rather bulky. there are also much better quality and feel earbuds that are much cheaper.

I bought these to connect to my computer for work from home.  They would not stay connected to a laptop...any laptop.  I tried several and the buds would just disconnect from them.  I called jbl who then said it is a computer problem because they would connect to my phone so I decided to try to use them with my phone because they were not cheap.  I know they are nowhere near the cost of the gold standard option but for my budget they are not cheap.  Here is the process to using them.  First, moisten the rubber pads by breathing on them.  Then jamb them into your ear until it feels as though you shoved a lit candle into your ear.  Turn on the noise canceling.  This part is essential to block out background noise then crank the sound all the way up.  This is not to jam out to rock,  this is just so that you can hear the audio book you are listening to.  Yeah, I'm that guy that listens to audio books for fun.  Now DO NOT MOVE.  Don't blink, don't look around ot they will jump out of your ears with even minor movement.  Try the different sized earpieces.  It will slightly adjust the heat level of the lit candle and will have no impact on how secure they are in your ears.  Turn off noise canceling and turn on ambient aware and you can hear mumbled conversations the neighbors the next block over are having.  Don't worry about privacy, nothing is clear enough to understand a word.  It is the same with someone conversing with you in the same room.  You get a great impression of Charlie brown listening to a class lecture, only amplified.  The last straw was today when I tried to spare my family of the latest book and only the left bud will connect.  It just so happens you have to have the right bud to do much of anything.  So for the bargain price of about $8 per use I have come to the end of the lifespan of these buds.  Not bad for what a jbl representative assure me is the quality that I should expect.  I will end this 9-month journey by biting the bullet and looking at some samsung buds or maybe a pair of Raycons.

product_name: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones, Up to 28H of Battery, Microphones, Wireless Charging, Hey Google and Amazon Alexa (Black)

reviews.review: Amazing pair of earphones. The noise canceling is pretty good, but the battery life is the most impressive. I use it for 4-5 hours of zoom calls everyday, but don’t have to charge it for almost two weeks. Connects very quickly to both my iPhone and mac. Calls are pretty flawless.”Tap” controls are a bit annoying since I can reset or change them only on the app on my phone, whereas I use mostly on my work laptop. Calls were accidentally muted because I tapped on them by mistake.Not used primarily for listening to music, but they sounded pretty decent and base heavy when I did use them for music

Best wireless earbuds i’ve ever owned. my friend lent me his pair after I lost my AirPods and I had to buy them after using them for a few days. More comfortable, stay in better, better sound quality, and look better. The only thing AirPods do better the the connecting to your phone. With these you have to get an app and connect them through the app and have use the app for all the features. But that’s to be expected with non apple products. Other than that, 9.5/10 would recommend.

For quality vs price, JBL's Live Pro+ TWS bluetooth earbuds are well worth the cost in my opinion. The sound is great (you can program your own EQ via the app among other options). The battery has a long life. The noise canceling works great. The only negative I've experienced is the noise canceling will occasionally stop working when tilting my head down. I don't know what is causing it at this time (it could be me). Luckily, it can be fixed by using the app to calibrate the fit of the earbuds; however, it can still be an annoyance. Regardless, I'm still loving the product. Recommended.

Took these out of the package and had them synced in minutes.  The sound is very good for the price point and the noise cancelling is a bonus.  They fit comfortably in my ear and I have been able to get up to 7 hours of straight listen time.  Compared to other brands I have tried, I would recommend these and would purchase them again for myself.  They make my workday go so much smoother as I can listen to podcasts and/or answer important calls.

Love the headsets, I bought them for conference calls and it does a great job with sound quality and noise cancellation, also really, really decent with music specially in quiet settings. It does even better after buying the third party Comply ear foams for this product (True Grip TW-200-C). If  zoom/phone calls or books are your purpose for getting these, it’s a top notch product much more affordable than Apple’s earbuds.

I love these I can use one or two and they work perfectly I love the sound and call quality! They have great battery life and and gentle on my ears (unlike the hard one that make my ears a little soar after ) I am so happy with my purchase and I would get them again

For the price I am very happy. Sure some features don't work as good as other more expensive headphone, but that's why they're more expensive. For what I paid I'm very happy, it connects to many devices with no problems. Only wish the  windows functionality was as good as the android one, but when using on my phone they're wonderful. Loud coworkers are totally silenced if playing music even quietly and the passthrough mode works great.

The earbuds are comfortable, fit well on the ears and provide good sound quality. BUT, for some unknown reason the microphone simply does not work. If I connect them for a call, I listen through the earbuds but the active mic is the one from the source device, so the other party hears extremely bad. It happens with Android and Mac, so, no chance to say it is an issue with those devices.I contacted JBL support and they didn't find any solution, so, at the end, I had to return the item back to Amazon.

product_name: JBL LIVE PRO+ TWS True Wireless In-ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones, Up to 28H of battery, Microphones, Wireless Charging, Hey Google and Amazon Alexa, iOS and Android compatible (Beige/Sand)

reviews.review: Amazing pair of earphones. The noise canceling is pretty good, but the battery life is the most impressive. I use it for 4-5 hours of zoom calls everyday, but don’t have to charge it for almost two weeks. Connects very quickly to both my iPhone and mac. Calls are pretty flawless.”Tap” controls are a bit annoying since I can reset or change them only on the app on my phone, whereas I use mostly on my work laptop. Calls were accidentally muted because I tapped on them by mistake.Not used primarily for listening to music, but they sounded pretty decent and base heavy when I did use them for music

Best wireless earbuds i’ve ever owned. my friend lent me his pair after I lost my AirPods and I had to buy them after using them for a few days. More comfortable, stay in better, better sound quality, and look better. The only thing AirPods do better the the connecting to your phone. With these you have to get an app and connect them through the app and have use the app for all the features. But that’s to be expected with non apple products. Other than that, 9.5/10 would recommend.

For quality vs price, JBL's Live Pro+ TWS bluetooth earbuds are well worth the cost in my opinion. The sound is great (you can program your own EQ via the app among other options). The battery has a long life. The noise canceling works great. The only negative I've experienced is the noise canceling will occasionally stop working when tilting my head down. I don't know what is causing it at this time (it could be me). Luckily, it can be fixed by using the app to calibrate the fit of the earbuds; however, it can still be an annoyance. Regardless, I'm still loving the product. Recommended.

Took these out of the package and had them synced in minutes.  The sound is very good for the price point and the noise cancelling is a bonus.  They fit comfortably in my ear and I have been able to get up to 7 hours of straight listen time.  Compared to other brands I have tried, I would recommend these and would purchase them again for myself.  They make my workday go so much smoother as I can listen to podcasts and/or answer important calls.

Love the headsets, I bought them for conference calls and it does a great job with sound quality and noise cancellation, also really, really decent with music specially in quiet settings. It does even better after buying the third party Comply ear foams for this product (True Grip TW-200-C). If  zoom/phone calls or books are your purpose for getting these, it’s a top notch product much more affordable than Apple’s earbuds.

I love these I can use one or two and they work perfectly I love the sound and call quality! They have great battery life and and gentle on my ears (unlike the hard one that make my ears a little soar after ) I am so happy with my purchase and I would get them again

For the price I am very happy. Sure some features don't work as good as other more expensive headphone, but that's why they're more expensive. For what I paid I'm very happy, it connects to many devices with no problems. Only wish the  windows functionality was as good as the android one, but when using on my phone they're wonderful. Loud coworkers are totally silenced if playing music even quietly and the passthrough mode works great.

The earbuds are comfortable, fit well on the ears and provide good sound quality. BUT, for some unknown reason the microphone simply does not work. If I connect them for a call, I listen through the earbuds but the active mic is the one from the source device, so the other party hears extremely bad. It happens with Android and Mac, so, no chance to say it is an issue with those devices.I contacted JBL support and they didn't find any solution, so, at the end, I had to return the item back to Amazon.

product_name: JBL Tune 230NC TWS - True Wireless In-Ear Headphones, Active Noise Cancelling with Smart Ambient, JBL Pure Bass Sound, 4 mics for perfect voice calls, IPX4, 40Hrs of battery life (Blue)

reviews.review: i used my last pair for five years, i think it was. the first thing that went was the charging - they didn't charge in the case. so i had to charge the earbuds by charging the case. then the case didn't charge as well anymore. then the battery of the earbuds declined so i only had maybe an hour of noise cancellation, which is my primary reason for using these. then they stopped pairing so well, and then ultimately one earbud stopped working altogether. so i bought another pair! these are worth buying when they're on sale the two times a year they go on sale. camelcamelcamel.com can tell you exactly by copying and pasting their URL.these have the best sound quality ever. the bass is AMAZING and makes all the difference for me. the other aspects of the quality are also incredible and the noise cancellation is the best i've tried so far. would definitely recommend - and have! my dad bought them as well, and he's very very picky about comfort. he always complains about how they fit in his ears. but he likes these and he is willing to work out with them as well.
Sound is really good. Also comes with different size cushions and is very comfortable in the ear. Haven’t had any issues and it stays charged for a long time

Updated 1 year later: I'm dropping my 5 stars to 4 stars. I still enjoy these headphones. And the battery is still good. After about an hour or so, my ears will start to get sore, but it's not too bad. They do cut out for about 1 sec maybe every 20 mins or so, but for the price I paid, I'm still pretty happy with them.I had not had a chance to really compare them with others until recently. We bought my dad for his birthday the Sony WF-1000XM5. They are double the price of these JBLs. He was having trouble with them so I took them for a week to find out what he was doing wrong (nothing was wrong - he wasn't wearing them correctly). While I was testing them, didn't cut out, and the sound, comfort, ambient aware and noise cancelling features were incredible. Sony's were 10x better than the JBLs.Bottom line: If you want a decent pair of noise cancelling earbuds without paying a fortune, I do believe, for the price, these JBLs are still a good buy. I liked being able to finally compare them, though, to another brand. Hope this helps.Previous post:I am super impressed with the noise canceling on these earbuds. I was looking for earbuds that had a good balance of comfort and noise cancelling and decent sound. With all the earbuds I have bought in the past I never found ones that were good at canceling the loud noise of plane engines when flying and I was always turning the sound up super loud just to hear the music. These earbuds are comfortable and did a fantastic job of canceling the background noise. I also really like the "ambient aware" function that allows me to turn off the noise canceling when my wife was talking next to me on the plane and I didn't have to take the earbuds out to hear her. I'm not an expert by any means, but I feel these $100 earbuds cancel out noise as well as some of the other more pricey $200-300+ over the ear brands I have played around with in stores that are big and bulky to carry around. The case is small and can fit in my pocket easily, and I can charge them while in my pocket. So when I have a layover flight, by time I got these out at my next flight gate or on the plane, they're ready to go. And I found them on sale on here for $50, which made it even better! I haven't tried these for working out or running yet so I can't say how they are with sweating and such. But for the casual wearer who would use them for something like traveling, these are DEFINITELY worth it! I highly recommend them.

I have one pair for work and one for home/going out. I wouldn’t have spent $100 on each pair but at $50 per pair they’re a good deal.The ANC is pretty impressive for little earbuds.  Makes the background sounds in an IHOP at 9:30 on a Sunday nearly disappear. They also eliminate the sound of snoring dogs and humans.Took a recent trip on an airplane and opted to bring these instead of my Sennheiser Momentum 3’s.  I’m an audiophile on a budget. They can’t compete with the over-ear Momentum for sound reproduction. But for earbuds they’re a great product at the sale price.There is a JBL app you can download to your smartphone but the controls are reasonably intuitive. I have big fingers so I probably miss the sweet-spot for function control more than the average person. I’ve found the bass to be a little lacking but I think that’s due to the EQ setting I’ve selected.  You do have some EQ presets to choose between in the app.They come with three sets of the rubber earplugs for various sizes of ear-canals. Medium worked for me. I can use them to sleep, travel, shut out the loud noises in restaurants, and for Zoom calls.Consider the color you want to stand out against your bedding when they fall out if falling asleep with them in.I like them enough that I bought a second, dedicated pair for work.The ANC has three settings but so far I haven’t found one that totally mutes audio output from your device in the “ambient-aware” or “talk through” modes. That’s a feature I like on my Momentum. It can be accomplished by the extra step of just pausing playback with a tap on the right, then tap the left to toggle through the three ANC modes.They work great with an iPhone as well as Windows 10/11 computers.Much greater clarity the the JLAB go, which don’t seem to have any functional ANC.  I should have spent the extra money at the get-go.Buy them when on sale. They’ll probably be fine for you.If ANC and a variety of EQ options are the most important features for you, spring for the current $300 - $400 Sony over-ears. I have a pair of those in the house-too. Their ANC is better but for the music I listen to the Sennheisers are #1.  However I would recommend the Sonys for over-ear for the average listener and these for travel, etc.  it’s a lot harder to lose a big set of cans than earbuds so I don’t want to invest too much in these little guys.JBL has always served me pretty well for the price in the pro-audio and live sound amplification area so I had some confidence in the name when I bought these.

I can use them to sleep, travel, shut out the loud noises in restaurants, and for Zoom calls.Consider the color you want to stand out against your bedding when they fall out if falling asleep with them in.I like them enough that I bought a second, dedicated pair for work.The ANC has three settings but so far I haven’t found one that totally mutes audio output from your device in the “ambient-aware” or “talk through” modes. That’s a feature I like on my Momentum. It can be accomplished by the extra step of just pausing playback with a tap on the right, then tap the left to toggle through the three ANC modes.They work great with an iPhone as well as Windows 10/11 computers.Much greater clarity the the JLAB go, which don’t seem to have any functional ANC.  I should have spent the extra money at the get-go.Buy them when on sale. They’ll probably be fine for you.If ANC and a variety of EQ options are the most important features for you, spring for the current $300 - $400 Sony over-ears. I have a pair of those in the house-too. Their ANC is better but for the music I listen to the Sennheisers are #1.  However I would recommend the Sonys for over-ear for the average listener and these for travel, etc.  it’s a lot harder to lose a big set of cans than earbuds so I don’t want to invest too much in these little guys.JBL has always served me pretty well for the price in the pro-audio and live sound amplification area so I had some confidence in the name when I bought these.

product_name: Soundcore P40i by Anker, Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds, Adaptive Noise Cancelling to Environments, Heavy Bass, 60H Playtime, 2-in-1 Case and Phone Stand, IPX5, Wireless Charging, Bluetooth 5.3

reviews.review: I got these as a lower-cost replacement for the 1st generation AirPods Pro that I had used for a few years (before one of the pods finally met its unfortunate demise), and I’d say they’re just about as good all-around as those were. The fact that these are a quarter of the price of the AirPods Pro is certainly astounding, and I’m legitimately very impressed. I have always thought highly of Anker/Soundcore’s products, but I bought these for $36 (on sale) and certainly did not expect them to be THIS good LOLSound quality: While the sound quality is not quite as good as the AirPods Pro, I found the smart EQ feature on the Soundcore app to be EXTREMELY helpful in getting the p40i earbuds to sound much better. The noise-cancellation of these p40i is also comparable to that of the AirPods Pro 1st gen in my opinion, given that you fit them properly into your ears (and I’m often in a noisy environment). I am happy with the way these sound; I own an expensive pair of over-the-ear headphones and I am generally picky about sound. When I do wear earBUDS though, I am not super super picky, and I just want something that can (1) be easily connected to my device (2) have long battery life (3) be durable, water-resistant. Basically, for earbuds, I’m looking for a workhorse, and these do the job while sounding excellent for the price!Battery life and Durability: I wear these earbuds A LOT (I can hear street noise inside my house at all hours, and wearing earbuds helps me to focus); while walking, exercising, cleaning, cooking, and also while showering (when I am not submerging my head in water of course), and the p40i have been perfect for all of those! The battery life is incredible, even after months of daily use- the battery life of the p40i is definitely better than that of the 1st gen AP Pros (which struggled to maintain even 2 hrs use even when fully charged after 2 yrs). They are definitely water-resistant and durable as well, having survived multiple instances of light water exposure and multiple drops. I have not kept the case in any sort of protector, and there are essentially no visible scratches on the exterior (again, this is another category in which the p40i offers better performance in my opinion than Apple’s airpods).Connectivity + conclusion: I used to think only Apple products could connect so seamlessly to my iPhone (which is a major selling point of Apple’s Airpods), but these p40i changing my mind! 98% of the time, I am connecting these to my iPhone 14. Connection is seamless, and I have only had to fully re-pair my phone and the p40i once in 5 months of ownership (pairing is also incredibly easy). Also, I have a Dell laptop and a Surface Pro (Windows OS), and the connectivity between my computers and the p40i is a much nicer experience than that of my computers and the Apple AirPods.Conclusion: Honestly, I will not be buying any AirPods device again because of the experience I have had with the p40i- although Airpods work great and are nice, I’ve accepted that earbuds in general just won’t last forever with daily use, so it doesn’t make sense to spend over $100 on them. In 2-3 years when I’m ready for new earbuds, I will likely buy one of Soundcore’s more expensive models as I am truly impressed with the overall quality of these budget-friendly p40i earbuds!

So I have been a huge audiophile my entire life driven with rhythm and sound of nature and creation. I have tried many audio devices and have never quite had the experience that I've been able to receive from soundcore audio. I have purchased the p20, p3i, p40i's twice (one for me and my wife), I also have the space q45, I also recently purchased and reviewed the Aero Fit pro.As far as the p40i they fit a lot differently than the p3is. I personally had issues keeping them in my ears without them falling out which led to their demise in a toilet. However while I had them their voice quality seemed unmatched. Posting the capacity for six mics not only does the noise canceling work amazingly. Near comparable to the q45s capacity. The sound distribution is fantastic providing a deep into you sound.  Touch base control makes it interesting and easy to trigger. In my opinion they are not set up for movement like sports or other physical activities. Connectivity, functionality, battery life and volume control function flawlessly. And overall clarity and value for money they offer a little more than the cheaper variety.

I ordered 3 different earbuds all within a similar price range(+\- $30) to figure out which one I liked the most - Soundcore Liberty 4 NC, P40i, and JBL Vibe Beam. Here are my notes and comparisons.The Liberty 4 NC is my favorite but there is one aspect I don’t like.They Liberty’s are very clear with good bass and their app allows you to customize EQ settings which is deal breaker for me. (All three pairs have custom EQs within their respective apps). The noise cancellation is great, comparable or even better than AirPros 2 and the fit is superb and on par with the P40i.The JBL Vibe was less comfortable but more so than JBL Tune(ordered these a while back). The JBL Vibes are not noise canceling and I knew that before hand so I’m not knocking it.The JBLs are fine for the price point but not the best for quality as they use 8mm drivers vs 11mm drivers for the Soundcore.The one thing I don’t like with the Liberty’s is the slightest white noise I get when between songs or silent parts. The P40i’s don’t have that problem. The P40i have great bass and fit just as well but they lack in higher frequencies and that’s important for audiophiles. The P40i also have a much friendlier app interface with many more preset features. BUT the Liberty’s have an option to set up your “ideal listening EQ” and that is a great feature as it adjusts to your preferred sound through samples and takes the guess work out.Overall the Liberty 4 NC’s took the cake with respect to comfort and sound quality. To me, it was worth the extra $. I can’t speak on longevity as I received all three and have been testing them individually the past couple days.

product_name: XIAOMI Watch S4 Smartwatch with 1.43-inch OLED Display NFC Bluetooth Calls Gesture Control 150+ Sports Modes 15-Day Battery HyperOS Alexa Model M2425W1 (Black)

reviews.review: Extraordinario producto

Beautiful screen even in bright daylight. Build quality is great. Battery life seems amazing. I got it with 54% charge. Turned on continuous sleep monitoring and after 2 days it's still at 51%. Changing bezels makes changing watch style easy and cheap. No wear OS, but I prefer better battery life. HyperOS is Very similar to Zepp OS from Amazfit, which to me, does everything I want it to do. Very pleased with the product.
Great watch. Battery life excellent. Great style and feel. Lightweight.
Watch has amazing battery life! Sleep tracker, fitness tracking and notifications all work flawlessly.
Muy bueno y cómodo
