I ordered these ear buds as a back up for when I can't find my favorite pair. They are decent. The sound quality is good enough for my everyday personal use. I listen to audio books so I don't know about how music sounds through these for people that want to know about hearing the different parts. Battery life is good, they charge pretty quickly. The ear buds connected easily to my phone.
sound quality bad, not noise cancellation at all.

These are decent ear pods.  Nothing special though.  They don’t stay charged as long as some of the others I’ve had. I do like that they come in black for a change!  For the price point, they are a great deal!

product_name: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones, Up to 28H of Battery, Microphones, Wireless Charging, Hey Google and Amazon Alexa (Black)

reviews.review: Amazing pair of earphones. The noise canceling is pretty good, but the battery life is the most impressive. I use it for 4-5 hours of zoom calls everyday, but don’t have to charge it for almost two weeks. Connects very quickly to both my iPhone and mac. Calls are pretty flawless.”Tap” controls are a bit annoying since I can reset or change them only on the app on my phone, whereas I use mostly on my work laptop. Calls were accidentally muted because I tapped on them by mistake.Not used primarily for listening to music, but they sounded pretty decent and base heavy when I did use them for music

Best wireless earbuds i’ve ever owned. my friend lent me his pair after I lost my AirPods and I had to buy them after using them for a few days. More comfortable, stay in better, better sound quality, and look better. The only thing AirPods do better the the connecting to your phone. With these you have to get an app and connect them through the app and have use the app for all the features. But that’s to be expected with non apple products. Other than that, 9.5/10 would recommend.

For quality vs price, JBL's Live Pro+ TWS bluetooth earbuds are well worth the cost in my opinion. The sound is great (you can program your own EQ via the app among other options). The battery has a long life. The noise canceling works great. The only negative I've experienced is the noise canceling will occasionally stop working when tilting my head down. I don't know what is causing it at this time (it could be me). Luckily, it can be fixed by using the app to calibrate the fit of the earbuds; however, it can still be an annoyance. Regardless, I'm still loving the product. Recommended.

Took these out of the package and had them synced in minutes.  The sound is very good for the price point and the noise cancelling is a bonus.  They fit comfortably in my ear and I have been able to get up to 7 hours of straight listen time.  Compared to other brands I have tried, I would recommend these and would purchase them again for myself.  They make my workday go so much smoother as I can listen to podcasts and/or answer important calls.

Love the headsets, I bought them for conference calls and it does a great job with sound quality and noise cancellation, also really, really decent with music specially in quiet settings. It does even better after buying the third party Comply ear foams for this product (True Grip TW-200-C). If  zoom/phone calls or books are your purpose for getting these, it’s a top notch product much more affordable than Apple’s earbuds.

I love these I can use one or two and they work perfectly I love the sound and call quality! They have great battery life and and gentle on my ears (unlike the hard one that make my ears a little soar after ) I am so happy with my purchase and I would get them again

For the price I am very happy. Sure some features don't work as good as other more expensive headphone, but that's why they're more expensive. For what I paid I'm very happy, it connects to many devices with no problems. Only wish the  windows functionality was as good as the android one, but when using on my phone they're wonderful. Loud coworkers are totally silenced if playing music even quietly and the passthrough mode works great.

The earbuds are comfortable, fit well on the ears and provide good sound quality. BUT, for some unknown reason the microphone simply does not work. If I connect them for a call, I listen through the earbuds but the active mic is the one from the source device, so the other party hears extremely bad. It happens with Android and Mac, so, no chance to say it is an issue with those devices.I contacted JBL support and they didn't find any solution, so, at the end, I had to return the item back to Amazon.

It happens with Android and Mac, so, no chance to say it is an issue with those devices.I contacted JBL support and they didn't find any solution, so, at the end, I had to return the item back to Amazon.

product_name: JBL Vibe Buds - True Wireless Earbuds, Smart Ambient, VoiceAware, Up to 32 total hours of battery life with speed charging, Water and dust resistant, JBL Deep Bass Sound (Black)

reviews.review: The headphones fit perfectly while also having really good bass and sound quality. But out of the box the sound is a little funky but after 5 minutes of use it returns back to normal and while getting really good sound quality and also have slot of battery life. I have been using them all day and it only got to around 80 percent on the JBL APP

I had to write this review after losing my old iOS Pro Buds and needing a new pair. These JBL Vibe Buds were on sale for $30, and I expected just okay for the price. But they’re amazing value. JBL has built solid products for years, and these are no exception. For $30, the sound is fantastic, and they stay in my ears without any issue—the default fit out of the box was perfect, and they arrived fully charged.The QR code for the JBL app is a nice touch, offering easy access to different sound settings. I’m an AI music creator, and these buds deliver some of the best sound I’ve heard, even compared to more expensive options.If I ever lose them again, I’ll definitely be buying another pair. Highly recommended

These work great, sound good, link up to Bluetooth easily.  But if you have them in your pocket or backpack and they separate from the charger, they can run out of battery, get lost or dirty.  I would highly recommend these for casual use.

These are eliteee, so basically yall im a gym girly and i usually go to the gym with my airpod pros but i left them somewhere and for someone who listens to music at work and etc i need to replace them quick, these are better than airpods!!! Bass is great, sound is clean, and they’re LOUD 10/10 get them also they dont have a top so that’s weird

This product is exceptionally excellent,  ive had this exactly a year to this date, amd ive had this in the toughest weather condition possible, and still functioning as new, great quality sound, I mean this things is excellent.  Love this high recommend this over any apple pods

DO NOT BUY THESE.These have been a problem from the start. The first pair I got, the audio squeaked and dropped every few seconds. They would barely work with Apple products, and they'd work okay with Microsoft products. I submitted for an exchange or refund WITHIN DAYS OF RECEIVING THEM, and Amazon rejected both. I then contacted JBL and started the process over. I very clearly explained that I had done all of the trouble shooting possible. I was told to try the troubleshooting again, as there was no other option. I told them I wasn't going to waste my time, and that they needed to make it right. I got no reply.A week later I got an email requesting a review of my service, HILARIOUS. I let them know I received a defective product and was ignored by both Amazon and JBL. I told them you're welcome for the free money.I immediately got a reply apologizing and information to return the defective products, as well as a tracking number for the replacement pair.Unfortunately, the new pair has the same issues, although not as severely. I decided to keep them because wasn't interesting in spending more time begging to get what I'm owed. Aside from the audio issues, the casing on these have begun to chip off. These headphones sit on my desk all day. They do not get jostled inside of a bag or moved around whatsoever.I've had these second pair almost a year, and now they work even less then the original pair did. I'm going to go to the gas station and buy a $5 pair, drive over them with my car a few times, and they'll still sound better and be more durable than these earbuds ever did.JBL, I never wanted to talk to you again, but you're about to hear from me. (Make sure you're not wearing the Vibe Buds!!)

For the price these are good. However, after a year of use, I noticed noticed bluetooth audio cutting out periodically which is frustrating and ruins music listening. Despite this, I would still recommend these.P.S buy a case!!! The JBL Vibe Buds case has some fragile corners that chip over time.

For the price, these are great. I like to keep a pair of headphones by my bed to listen to audiobooks or music in bed. I had to replace an old pair of airpods because they wouldn’t hold a charge longer than 30 minutes. My primary focus was battery life. I fall asleep with these JBLs in and in the morning they still have at least half battery after sitting out of the case all night long. Second want for ear buds was something better at noise canceling than airpods (husband snores). These are exceptional at noise cancelling and you don’t have to turn the volume up super loud to achieve it. Only complaint, and this is totally my fault, is that the rubber tips are slightly too large for my ears and they fall out a lot or make my ears sore. But they came with either replacement rubber tips or different sizes in the box when i got them and i threw them away. Since then ive been having a hard time finding generic replacement tips that don’t disrupt the charging on these. But like i said that’s on me. Anyways TL:DR baby best the price, excellent battery life, above average noise cancelling.

Same-day delivery, secure packaging, an easy-to-use watch with an intuitive interface. A large, high-resolution screen with responsive touch functionality.

product_name: Wireless Earbuds, in Ear Headphones with 4 ENC Mics, Bluetooth 5.4 Ear Buds Hi-Fi Stereo, 36H Playtime Earphones with USB-C Charging Case, 3g Lightweight, IP7 Waterproof Headset for Running

reviews.review: Great earbuds for the price. Sound quality is good, and actually blocks more noise than expected.

For someone hard-of-hearing like myself, these are the answer to my prayers.  Didn't have to spend a boatload of money, either.  Frankly, I don't know how they can sell them so reasonably.  I had a pair of large, with full ear cups, bluetooth headphones to listen to TV.  My wife doesn't like the high volume so I had to wear them all the time during the day / evening with the TV audio muted when watching unless we were watching a movie / TV program she wanted to watch with me.  Now I can hear her and the TV simultaneously so she doesn't have to yell at me to override the old headphones.  The audio is perfect.  The old headphones were extremely poor for high frequencies and were very heavy with the bass.  Without the high frequencies everything sounded muffled and forget trying to understand what foreign actors are trying to say on my favorite shows.  I could understand 20-40% of what they were saying no matter how loud I had the headphones jacked up and background music in the film / TV show just made it all that much worse.  No longer!  Great audio, lots of high frequency response so I can watch everything now and understand all the words being spoken.  These work great for music, too, on my iPhone and MacBook devices.  I bought a bluetooth transmitter on Amazon (1Mii SafeFly Dual | Bluetooth 5.3 Adapter Bluetooth Transmitter w/Screen for Wireless Headphones), plugged the 3mm audio plug into the headphone jack on the TV and away we went after pairing.  The SafeFly transmitter mentioned comes with a USB charging port so I just plugged it into a USB to AC adapter into the outlet behind the TV so it remains fully charged at all times.  These are great for the hard-of-hearing like myself.
Very happy with this purchase. You have to make sure the earbuds are in tightly or you may have charging issues. But the sound is very high quality and has good volume too!
Great quality, fits comfortably and look forward to seeing more variety of colors very soon
Good product

I bought these for my wife. She said they connected to her phone instantly every time she turns them on. They are much louder than her Sony's that she had. I'm very pleased with the purchase!!! Value is right on, along with the sound quality. I also love the design and weight and is so easy to use!!
I like these earbuds, but they fall out easily. they seem to have a long battery life

The sound quality is ok. I really like perfect sound systems and these are good for the price and most people will be happy with these. They work very well, easy to use. Cancelled enough sound for most. I prefer headphones.Goosenest rating; your call, most will enjoy

product_name: JBL Vibe 100 TWS True Wireless In-Ear Headphones w/Charging Case - Black (Renewed)

reviews.review: These ear buds have lasted two years now, my kids loved them. JBL had my business after I heard the sound difference from other ear buds.
Work great and the charge last a good long time
Great!

Very good sound quality. Definitely water resistant. Super hard to be destroyed. Worth the buy. Easy to use. One-time connecting necessary. My only problem is the distance it covers if you should step away from your phone. VERY good buy, but if you need distance, buy the JBL Vibe 200TWS version for a greater distance coverage.

So first off I bought 2 sets of these I wanna say 2 years ago ish.. maybe a little less I can't remember. One for me one for my husband which later another became mine lol..So i work at gfs a huge warehouse. First tome I dropped one of the ear buds thru the grates I'm the floor.. not just onto the floor 5 storys.. I managed to see where it landed and it's a crane zone so I had to get my boss to get it.. he found it still worked.. a few weeks go buy I fumbled the whole case ear phones and all in the freezer where I work all the time.. I loose one found the other. A week goes buy and one of my friends in janitorial was cleaning mind you another 3 storys.. finds it! I charge it up it still works! Another time samet headphones bc it's got a different color rubber on it bc I lost the one it came with.. I was doing some cleaning in another dept and had a mop bucket next to me full of kinda Nasty water.. not gonna lie. I feel the head phone slip out of my ear.. and I tried to catch it bit instead hand paddled it right into the mop bucket 😅 I kid you not.. it was in there for a good 10 seconds bc I had to roll up my sleeve to reach in.. I flicked it off dried it with a cloth real good left it in my bag so it could get the monster out before charging it.. and sure as shoot it still works.. but they have become a bit annoying now bc I do work in the freezer below 0 for like 12 hours 5 days a week.. nothing charges in that.. I still use both sets they usually die about 4 hours to 5 hours in and I swap to my husband's old pair lol. But I can't complain with these they have quite a story to tell. 😅 I do wish they were rated below 0 so they lasted longer but sometimes if they do die I just leave them in they make for great noise canceling with all the fans and belts going it gets loud and when I hear the fans running it makes me even colder so even dead they have there use.The bass is also great.Case could have a cover but they still hold on with Magnet.

We have had these for 4 months.  They worked great in the first 2 months.  After that, they are not returnable and now they will not connect to any blue tooth device.  It will not go into pair mode, even after watching a couple how to videos, it still will not go into pair mode.  They are basically useless at this time.The battery life when they worked, was great, the sound was very nice for an ear bud.  I have other JBL headphones, sound bars, and portable devices that work great, but these earbuds are not working as they should have.I'm looking into the factory warranty now and hope they can exchange them, I'm just too late to do that on Amazon's platform.

For the price these are great if they fit your ear.  The buds come with 3 tips that will most likely fit most people's ears, however none of the 3 fit my ears snug enough to stay in while running.  I was constantly fiddling with them on runs to keep them from falling out.  I bought some after market tips to put on that hold the buds in place a lot better, but the charging case isn't deep enough for some of the tips, so I have to remove the tips in order to charge the earbuds.
These ear buds are fantastic and I have zero complaints. Easy to use and stay in my ears throughout the day. I have at least one in 5 days a week all day. I love the quality for the price.

product_name: Skullcandy Dime Evo Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth Headphones, Noise Isolating Fit, Up to 36 Hours Battery, Microphone for iPhone Android, Easy Carry with Clip-Anywhere Case - True Black

reviews.review: So I can say this, the dime evo has great battery life for the earbuds and the holder of the earbuds.Noise cancellation is really good but may attenuate some of the high frequencies, but that could be just my ears.Tap three times on the left earbud and you hear sound around you.Tap again three times and you’re back into noise cancellation.I have to say that I’ve been very impressed by this model in all aspects.They fit my ears very well and for someone who has very small ear canals I’m very impressed and how well they fit.I could be jogging or in a full run, and I have no worries of them ever falling out! so if you’re looking for some earbuds that have really good clarity very easy to control your volume on them. Good mic, quality when you’re talking to someone on the phone battery life noise, cancellation I’m telling you these are really a nice set of earbuds to get in for the price you really can’t go wrong.

Amazing quality for an amazing price just as good as my old bose that i had before these. My bose lasted me a good like 10 or more years they still work but are falling apart so I got these I can confidently say these are just as good if not better than my bose very comfortable in my small ears and the sound quality is top tier!! They also have better noise cancelation than my bose and no sound leaking out for other people to hear. I like how portable these are with a clip on the case so I can clip them on my jeans instead of putting them in my pocket which was my issue with my bose because the case is really big. They were really easy to connect through the app I was also able to connect them without the app but I personally like using the app because it tells you information like the batery of each earbud and lets you cusomize the sound along with other things.

Pros and cons.These things stay charged forever, and their case recharges them quickly. I can go a week without charging the case, though I usually only use one at a time in public.The sound is amazing and they fit in my ears comfortably.The only negative is that the outside plastic piece fell off of one of the buds within a few days. I'm careful with them and don't remember dropping it or anything. It doesn't affect the function, just makes the button harder to push. Small negative that I just wanted to mention.All in all, they are incredible earbuds when considering the price,volume, sound quality, and especially battery life. The clip is also very handy

These earbuds are great. They connect seamlessly and can even connect to two devices at once, which is great for me when I am working on both my laptop and work PC. They don't have active voice canceling, but their sound blocking is so good that people have had to tap me on the shoulder to get my attention even when I'm only listening at low volumes. Sound quality is also good! Battery life is also decent and can last me a full day wearing them.

These are the best earbuds I’ve ever had. Period. As someone who has gotten through SEVERAL pairs of earbuds over the years, no company has provided the best value like Skullcandy does on the dime products. I’ve had the dime 3 for over a year now as my go to and I upgraded to the dime evo today, the difference in features is wild considering this pair is $60, only a few dollars more than the dime 3. They sound great and neutral, work seamlessly with 2 devices at once, and thy have the app to control the equalizer. I honestly can’t ask for more and I thank Skullcandy for creating an amazing product for an insanely great price.

these headphones are awesome for the price. i accidentally dropped of of the earbuds in the toilet i was worried that it would break it or make the audio sound worse. but after i managed to get it out and clean it off it sounded perfectly fine and it didnt mess with the charging process either. they are in fact noise canceling if you have both earbuds in with a high enough volume. sound quality is crisp you can hear every instrument and beat. very good headphones if on a budget

I love these earbuds, i use them for work and they fit well without falling out as i move alot and the charge lasts well over 10 hours. Also the case is super handy. Definitely worth more than what they cost.
I love these, they have good audio and block out the noise pretty well. They connect easy and the battery life is impressive. I generally hook them onto my belt loop.

Good mic, quality when you’re talking to someone on the phone battery life noise, cancellation I’m telling you these are really a nice set of earbuds to get in for the price you really can’t go wrong.

Amazing quality for an amazing price just as good as my old bose that i had before these. My bose lasted me a good like 10 or more years they still work but are falling apart so I got these I can confidently say these are just as good if not better than my bose very comfortable in my small ears and the sound quality is top tier!! They also have better noise cancelation than my bose and no sound leaking out for other people to hear. I like how portable these are with a clip on the case so I can clip them on my jeans instead of putting them in my pocket which was my issue with my bose because the case is really big. They were really easy to connect through the app I was also able to connect them without the app but I personally like using the app because it tells you information like the batery of each earbud and lets you cusomize the sound along with other things.

Pros and cons.These things stay charged forever, and their case recharges them quickly. I can go a week without charging the case, though I usually only use one at a time in public.The sound is amazing and they fit in my ears comfortably.The only negative is that the outside plastic piece fell off of one of the buds within a few days. I'm careful with them and don't remember dropping it or anything. It doesn't affect the function, just makes the button harder to push. Small negative that I just wanted to mention.All in all, they are incredible earbuds when considering the price,volume, sound quality, and especially battery life. The clip is also very handy

These earbuds are great. They connect seamlessly and can even connect to two devices at once, which is great for me when I am working on both my laptop and work PC. They don't have active voice canceling, but their sound blocking is so good that people have had to tap me on the shoulder to get my attention even when I'm only listening at low volumes. Sound quality is also good! Battery life is also decent and can last me a full day wearing them.

These are the best earbuds I’ve ever had. Period. As someone who has gotten through SEVERAL pairs of earbuds over the years, no company has provided the best value like Skullcandy does on the dime products. I’ve had the dime 3 for over a year now as my go to and I upgraded to the dime evo today, the difference in features is wild considering this pair is $60, only a few dollars more than the dime 3. They sound great and neutral, work seamlessly with 2 devices at once, and thy have the app to control the equalizer. I honestly can’t ask for more and I thank Skullcandy for creating an amazing product for an insanely great price.

these headphones are awesome for the price. i accidentally dropped of of the earbuds in the toilet i was worried that it would break it or make the audio sound worse. but after i managed to get it out and clean it off it sounded perfectly fine and it didnt mess with the charging process either. they are in fact noise canceling if you have both earbuds in with a high enough volume. sound quality is crisp you can hear every instrument and beat. very good headphones if on a budget

I love these earbuds, i use them for work and they fit well without falling out as i move alot and the charge lasts well over 10 hours. Also the case is super handy. Definitely worth more than what they cost.
I love these, they have good audio and block out the noise pretty well. They connect easy and the battery life is impressive. I generally hook them onto my belt loop.

product_name: LEEMC Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth Headphones 6.0, Ear Buds with Touch Screen, ANC ENC Noise Cancelling, 40H Bass Stereo Sound Over-Ear Earphones for iOS, Android, Sports, Workout，Charcoal

reviews.review: I recently purchased the LEEMC Wireless Earbuds and they have exceeded my expectations, particularly regarding functionality and design.Key Highlights:• Smart Touch Screen Case: The ability to control noise cancellation settings and monitor battery life directly from the case is incredibly efficient. It eliminates the need to constantly check my phone to manage the earbuds.• Secure Over-Ear Design: These are perfect for active use. The hooks provide a very stable fit during movement, making them ideal for sports and workouts without the fear of them falling out.• Performance: The Bluetooth 6.0 connection is stable with no noticeable lag. The noise cancellation (ANC/ENC) performs well in noisy environments, and the bass response is deep and clear.• Battery Life: With 40 hours of total playtime, they hold a charge significantly longer than many higher-priced competitors.Final Verdict: These offer a premium experience with unique features at a great price point. If you want reliable workout headphones with a high-tech edge, these are a solid choice.

The TP03 earbuds deliver great sound quality, comfortable fit, and reliable Bluetooth connection for the price. Excellent battery life and easy setup make them perfect for everyday use. Highly recommended! 2nd pair that’s how good they are for the price!

Easy to set up and easy to use. The functionality of the charging port and the touch screen is a nice bonus. I recommend this to anyone that is looking for comfortable wireless earbuds. Great sound and great quality. Thank you!
Easy to set up! Good sound! Lots of great and fun features! Great gift! Case is touchscreen. Long battery life. So far, there is nothing negative to say.
Excellent earbuds and sound quality. The Bluetooth is very fast and reliable. The case's touch screen controls, and the long charging battery life, are excellent.
Easy connection. Easy to use settings all on the charging pebble. Great sound quality. Using them as I write this. Noise canceling feature seems to work well. Comfortable.

The headphones exceeded my expectations. The battery lasts longer than expected, and the sound is crystal clear. They really cancel out external noise. They're an excellent gift for any occasion, or simply for personal use. I highly recommend them; they're incredibly good.
So far so good they’re comfortable to wear they’re good to use they function nicely battery life we’re going to find out volume control is great so far it’s worth the money

product_name: Monster Clarity 101 AirLinks Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.0 in-Ear Headphones with Charging Case, Stereo Earphones Deep Bass Sound, IPX5 Waterproof, Built-in Mic, Clear Call, Secure Fit for Sports

reviews.review: I have been looking for a good pair of earbuds for a few months now. I have the Steel series arctic earbuds that are 150$, and four others. The Monster earbuds are better than all of them. My SS buds were great but the ANC broke after about a week. Then a month later the transparency feature suddenly made them so quiet they are not worth using. The other pairs are just mid and meh. But these Monsters have deep bass which for me is a must, and they sound fantastic! I am an avid music/podcast listener and gamer. These are perfect for all uses! They feel well made and solid! The case is great and I love the design. All of this to say they are IMO very much worth the price! I got them on a deep discount but if I had to pay Full price I would not feel ripped off like the SS arctic buds. Highly recomend! Only issue was the ear pads were too small and I had to use some from a different pair. But I have big ears lol! Once I used different pads they sound just like I had hoped.

Been knowing about monster brand since highschool (2010) always wanted a pair but never seem to afford it. Yes later I came across them again. And this I got them. And it is definitely well worth it brand and quality. Usually prefer the bigger ear piece but had to switch to the smaller ones due to the big ones hurting my ears. But over 10/10 in sound quality, and design.

I'm a mid grade earbud buyer and these are pretty darn good, got them for a great price for cyber Monday (close to half off) they replaced my higher end series of JBL's. The sound quality is better than the JBL vibe 100 by far. The only trade off is the volume does not get as high as the JBL's. The monsters could be a bit louder, the JBL's at full blast are too loud to tolerate to where the monsters at full blast are just nowhere near as loud. The sound quality is the key, the monsters are hands down better between lows mids and hi. The range and crystal clear sound outweighs making your ears bleed. I also thing the charging case on the monsters is a MUCH better design. Overall 5* but to be honest if I paid sticker price as opposed to half off I would be disappointed and it would fall to 3*. If you can get a good deal for them grab it!
These are really nice..Sounds great. Battery life good...

I'm a huge Monster Audio fan, even their lower priced items tend to have decent sound for the money you'll spend.  I really liked these, they sound great with a full range which for me is important as I listen to just about everything from early 20th jazz, Big Band from the 20's & 40's and most anything up through current selections. One problem I've had with other Bluetooth buds is they tend to fall of my ears with even slight activity but these didn't have that issue at all. I was able to wear them while working on my hobbies which include wood working as well during physical therapy which could ne fairly vigorous without having to readjust them. I especially liked that they didn't fall out while sleeping. Put them in at bedtime and still have them in at 5am.The issue I have with them and it's a big one is after several months charging became a major issue.  I tried cleaning the contacts on both the case and buds to no avail and unless I left them for a day in the case it was unlikely I'd have even half a charge. At first it was just the right ear bud but then it was both. It really became a nuisance when you'd leave them in the case for 12 hours only to find they were still at 10% the next morning. We finally gave up on them and ordered a new pair of earbuds.

Very good ear buds. Clean, clear sound, with good fit. Fast, trouble-free connectivity. Cylindrical ear bud case charges ear buds between uses, AND it easily fits in a pepper spray belt case - handy! Only problem is top volume could be a little louder. Still worth 5 stars. Good value for the purchase dollar.

I bought these, the 700 anc and Champions because I use buds A LOT and the price on Amazon was good. The backup batteries are all across the spectrum with this one being the medium but still not great, like the Champions. Sound quality was mid pack but the not far behind the 700's. Function is perfected when it comes to thermal, too sensitive and adjustments become inadvertent actions. Form is really nice as well, i really like the framing, finish and the LED actually looks linear. Connects within a second or 2 and range is similar to skullcandy which imo has the best range I've seen. Love the L/R connectivity as well, normally I had to always carry 2 sets for work. IPX rated so I can work in them and I also like the case with the slide window. The only functions it's missing is ambient microphone and anc but for half the price of the 700's that's ok with me.Update: after using these for a few weeks I wanted to leave a few notes. Battery life on the buds are the best I've seen on individual buds. I'm usually only wearing 1 at a time but most days 1 bud will outlast the battery on my phone and I am almost always listening to something. The charging case isn't quite as good and needs to be charged every few days. The Monster Champions is a heavier case but will last literally weeks on a single charge and daily use. Despite that these are the best buds I've ever owned and I've had literally dozens. I wear these over my ANC 700's, Beats, Klipsch, several JBL's, several Skullcandy's and Sony buds. Lastly, fit is also the best I've experienced. I normally don't have problems finding buds that fit and usually use the supplied medium sized inserts but these stay in place as good as any. I'm not fumbling with them while I work outside in Texas and I love that.

product_name: JBL Tune Buds - True wireless Noise Cancelling earbuds, JBL Pure Bass Sound, Bluetooth 5.3, 4-Mic technology for Crisp, Clear Calls, Up to 48 hours of battery life, Water and dust resistant (Blue)

reviews.review: A lot of pros with one con.I didn’t think I had a lot of time for earbuds during the day, so I started off trying a cheap pair. They were $20 or something with 4.8 stars and reviews like, “I haven’t used my Airpods since buying these!” so I thought that sounded perfect.They sucked. The sound was harsh, they became painful after extended use, noise cancelling was barely noticeable, etc.  I can’t actually remember all of the problems at this point.  BUT they sold me on the functionality of wireless headphones.Fast-forward to a few months later - it’s Black Friday and I bite on these because they’re on sale.  I was a little hesitant because they had a lowly 4.2 stars.  Turns out average reviews aren’t everything.These are the polar opposite of the highly-reviewed, cheap headphones I tried: they’re comfortable, and the sound is amazing.  As the title implies, I master audio so this is not a hollow endorsement. The cheap ones had hyped bass, missing mids, and painful presence/treble.  These are very flat and well-performing by comparison, and can be EQ’d. The noise cancelling is also VERY respectable. I frequently work around loud sources and am sensitive to loud noises, and I have accidentally left these in when I intended to swap for earplugs, because the performance is similar.I love the app. Being able to select between audio quality vs. video sync’ing is awesome when I want to watch live musical performances where sync issues play with your mind. Being able to create custom EQ settings is  very important to me too.The con is that you have to take them out of the case to power them on. It’s not a huge deal - it’s easy to pop them in for a split second if they’ve timed out or something.  But there has been one occasion that I ran somewhere and forgot the case.  I intend to live my life without dependence on crap like headphones, so no big deal - take a break.I would normally give something like this 4 stars because that power-on function is a notable miscalculation on JBL’s part, but it deserves a much better average review than it has so I’m doing my part to raise it.  In everyday life it’s not that big of a deal unless you’re the kind of person who loves to find things to complain about.

I bought these on the Black Friday sale and man, I'm so glad I did.  I have several pairs of the lesser Vibes, which sound good, but these blow them out of the water.First, let's address the fitment.  I see many say they don't fit, they fall out, or feel like they're going to fall out.  Don't put the large ear pads on if you don't have large ear canal openings!  This will cause the earbuds to push themselves out.  Too large will push them out, while too small will obviously not have enough to grip your ear.  Test them all to find the right fit, if not, reach out to JBL, I'm sure they have replacement pads of other sizes.  You can also buy them here on Amazon as they're pretty universal.I find pushing them in, and turning them into place, with the proper pads, netted a great seal and no falling out.You HAVE to install the app on your phone; otherwise, you're getting the flat sound your phone manufacturer decided sounded good.  The JBL app is available for Apple and Android - and it makes a massive difference, especially with the noise cancellation and frequency response.With these, I'm hearing songs I've listened to for decades for the first time.  I'm hearing effects and instruments I never heard in the music.  These are that clear.  They also don't kill my ears!  I've tried earbuds from $5 to $300, and while the more expensive ones sounded terrific, they hurt my ears physically.  With these, I get great sound and a great fit with a tremendous battery life.I'm reading a lot of negative reviews where either the fit or the sound is the problem. Most of these would be positive if people were provided with either longer pads so they go a bit further into the ear and more sizes and those with sound complaints would actually install the app.  Mine sounded horrible with the Dolby equalizer baked into Android 13.  Installing the app AND turning off any phone equalizer or sound enhancer was the solution.  I'd definitely buy these again!

Great product! The quality of the sound Is pristine and clear and has nice bass to it.The problem: it keeps coming off my ear so I find myself usually adjusting it so the won’t fall. It does happens more with the left but both ears do it. Thats the only problem honestly. I have an iPhone 13 Pro Max and it syncs well.Ear size: I also change a bigger ear tip so they fit more snug but still after a while they start coming off even though when I rotate it so stays put But that’s probably also because I’m working out when that Happens.Battery last a long time!

Good sounding. Noise canceling is great for the price.  Talk through/passive is very functional. Case and buds put through washer. Then dried at 120*F for 36 hours. No sign of life at all from anything. Plugged in case to charge and everything woke up and works fine now! My ear canals are very small and had to use aftermarket smaller tips but fit well now. If you have to use the small or extra small tips usually just order black so they match aftermarket color ones if you care.Only issue I have is you cant have all the ambient controls, media controls, and volume control its two of the three.

product_name: TOZO Wireless Earbuds Build in Mic Clear Calls Ergonomic Light Weight Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Headphones Waterproof Premium Stereo Sound Ear Buds 30H Playtime with 32 EQs via APP

reviews.review: After reading several reviews, these T12s seemed to be a very good deal. Especially for the price.I was quite skeptical because the last pair I just returned had some really great reviews too. However, I received my Tozo T12 Earbuds today, January 2, 2021. I received them just as all the video reviews stated with all the items included as advertised. Mine were charged to 85%. I followed the simple instructions and I was up and running in less than 5 minutes. I was seriously impressed with the sound quality. WOW!I let the earbuds and the base charge to 100%. I had some work to do in the garage that took about 1 hour. This gave me the time to play around with my new earbuds. Did I mention the sound quality? After several songs these  earbuds are incredible. They are light weight and seems like they will stay in place. I was climbing and bending over, moving freely with no discomfort in my ears. In fact I had forgot these were in my ears at one point. I was able to quickly adapt to the touch controls. Very easy.I was having a conversation with my wife (after I paused the music) and I still couldn't hear her clearly. I had to remove one of the ear pieces. The earbud really seals the outside noise very nicely. I'm going to try these when I use the trimmer this summer. They should act as a set of hearing protection and I can listen to music.But my real test is going to be when I use these at the gym. I only bought them for that purpose. For some reason, my gym loves to play some crap music. It sounds like they play the same song over and over and over. It is cruel and unusual punishment. The pair of earbuds I had and just returned never stayed in my ears. With a little sweat, I was constantly fussing with them and not having a good seal made the sound quality horrible. So we shall see if my Tozo T12s will do what the other one could not. From my short experience I have had so far I have confidence these WILL stay put and I will have the sound quality I was searching for. But I will soon find out on Monday!Update, today is January 20, 2021.Let me say, you will not be disappointed with the Tozo T12s.  After a little more than 3 weeks, I have used these while climbing up and down a ladder, bending over, under ear muffs (wood working) just about any position and these ear buds DO NOT fall out and are comfortable. But most importantly, I use them at the gym. I don't go to the gym to update my social status, I go there to sweat and I sweat a lot. These T12s have stayed in place and are comfortable. Never have I had to adjust or fuss with them after putting them in.You get a rich full range of sound. Deep bass and crisp highs. Incredible!! I'm hearing sounds that I have never heard from music that I have listened to for years.You have two sets of volume control. Your device, if turned way down, will affect the volume to the earbuds. And you have a volume control on the earbuds. Think of your device being the master volume control. If it is low or off you will not have very much volume at the earbuds even at full (on the earbuds). I set my devise almost up to full volume and control the earbuds from there.So far I have only had to charge the case only once in three weeks.The only negative thing I can say about these earbuds, the first week in the gym I was hearing a very loud popping sound from my left ear and only after the sweat started to flow. The popping happened with every step while running on the treadmill. It sounded like the cap on a jar when the vacuum seal was broken. But loud. I figured out that the silicone tip, after it was wet, was braking the seal between my ear and the silicone ear piece. I fixed that by buying a set of foam tips. I don't hear the popping anymore. But I do hear my bones rattling around now. I can't fix that. If you are experiencing this I think the foam tips can fix that. No need to buy an expensive pair. Here are the ones I bought. https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07SN4HP5Z/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o07_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 $7.I hope this helps someone. Trust me I'm confident that you will love these too. Especially at the $40 price point. Good luck!

great sound and comfort. dirt cheap and way better than the a1 model. sadly it says it has wireless charging but mine does not. otherwise worth every penny. i even threw my nc9 away because i like these better.

Background:I am a person that even if you ignore the other brand Earbuds I have and like, (with TOZO … I’d say Tribit and Earfun are up there) … I have quiet the collection of models from TOZO including the T6s (both variety), T9, NC2 and 2024 NC9s, A1s, Crystal Buds and Crystal Pods, the A3s, and I have experience with the original NC9s and NC7s (I am sure I am even forgetting a model or two) . Oh yeah and the E2s (to answer my own question about the E2s in comparison to these, I will get to that later)My intial thoughts (given that I did have these before my A1s but expected about the same thing) were that the sound BLEW me away for this price .. I do admit I got these for $19.99 with a 6 dollar off e-coupon to make these under $15 (before I go on, I still say these would be worth that $19.99)… after a first walk of a few miles with the DEFAULT “flat”/”standard” EQ I tried what I thought was the best option and while usually use custom EQ settings … I tried the “Rock” Preset and after two days of that… I felt these were dialed in.  JUST now I tried them again and while it’s so close to being “perfect” (so to speak…keep expectations in-check) … the midbass which IS boosted in the “Rock” preset is just a tad too much .. in the great TOZO app I pulled the first few bass sliders to A) line-up and B) are above the “zero” line but lower than the Rock preset(like I said in my A1 review, I plan on uploading my preset to the EQ Zone in the TOZO App … this gives you the ability to download other people’s EQ settings and apply them to YOUR TOZO buds with only a few clicks … VERY cool and handy) .This sound is really dialed in more to “exactly” how I like it.  The only thing  I may say about these vs say the 2024 NC9 SOUND … is that things seem more “refined” overall in the 2024 NC9 (crisper, more separation perhaps), but these are DARN GOODBefore I go on … Build quality, battery life (so far), and that sort of stuff … seems typical for TOZO … and that means “it’s great” … sure compared to some buds these may “feel a little cheaper” (say the T6s or 2024 NC9s) but THEY DO NOT feel “cheap”.  To try to clear up confusing … with cheap QUALITY buds “you get what you pay for… what’d you expect” comes to mind … what I am trying to say is that TOZO probably cut back on these to keep the price lower but they are still a good quality earbud and case.Comparisons- I will try to keep this short but informative(any .. old classic with no app support and 32hrs advertised battery life .. .or new style “classic” or “ergonomic edition” TOZO T6):- I think the T6s (not what I said about the build quality still being good on the E1s) MAYBE a little better but it’s “splitting hairs”.- Sound Quality … hard to say since the old T6s do not have app support hence no TOZO App EQ support…. STILL . With some EQ tweaking and I mean MINOR tweaking .. they are totally in the same ballpark … These E1s to me are ALOT closer in sound to the T6s than say they are to the A1sTOZO A1s:I can legit see TOZO making these E1s the “new gen” A1s they are so close and even making a little spreadsheet of features comparing the two here, there are only MINOR differences they are so close … on paper.- what I will say is that while I am dialing in my A1s EQ a little more … they have two issues to me with the sound.  A) say at 100% volume the A1s are where any other TOZO bud including these are at say 70% volume and that is an issue at times with tracks with lower volumes.  NOT terrible for the A1s but just something to note.  The A1s lack “body” or “richness” to me in the mids .. .at least compared to say the TOZO T6s for instance.  These E1s just need minor tweaking vs the A1s they are so much like and sound so much better.  I don’t feel the sound “blows me away” as much (if I forget I only paid $13.90 for these) as it did at first but it’s so good for this price range, I am nit-picking at that point. These have the punch in the low end (how much of a punch is what I am dialing in to my “perfect sound” listening to things from light jazz to rap and metal, here) that I feel the A1s lack at times.The E1s have a “more controlled “ bass to me …and without repeated tweaking of the EQ which I am still trying with the A1s .. I am not noticing that “syballant” sound on some of the tracks near the high-end.  (For the record I feel I am trashing the A1s… I have no plans on returning my A1s and I do NOT “hate them” .. I just feel these E1s OVERALL are better)Fit wise the A1s and E1s may not be “identical” but without trying them on as I am typing this review I cant remember if one is better … close enough to being the same for my tastes and that is “maybe not the perfect fit but TOTALLY comfortable”TOZO E2:This will answer my own question about the E2s before I bought those.  The style (even how the case opens uniquely) is really cool and I like that more than I expected.  The build quality of the E2s are about the same as these E1s in my viewWhile I am still dialing things in, NOT saying things sound “100% the same” I am going off memory here to what I like and the tracks (music) I was listening to at the time.  The E2s and E1s are really close and more in the ballpark of each other…. Both in my opinion sound better than the A1s which between the three models are the ones that still lack “richness” at times .. it’s like the E1s and E2s are dialed in even out of the factory, more than the A1s.------------------------------Not sure what I can say specifically that will not make this review too long and boring.  I think between the A1s and E1s that are OFTEN (I got then at an identical price) about the same price…. Regular, lightning deals, or regular price + coupons … I’d totally go with the E1s, though I feel I am hating on the A1s (again these two models are SO SIMILAR it’s hard to tell them apart sometimes not counting the sound and case-shape) .. the A1s are not bad but these are just a bit better.The E2s I would not say are “a lot better” or worse than these but they are in the same ballpark … and for about $40 (not counting sales which would bring that down) … you could get both E1 and E2s.To be honest .. I have more than one pair of these E1s due to e-coupons and sales … so yes I recommend them

I just feel these E1s OVERALL are better)Fit wise the A1s and E1s may not be “identical” but without trying them on as I am typing this review I cant remember if one is better … close enough to being the same for my tastes and that is “maybe not the perfect fit but TOTALLY comfortable”TOZO E2:This will answer my own question about the E2s before I bought those.  The style (even how the case opens uniquely) is really cool and I like that more than I expected.  The build quality of the E2s are about the same as these E1s in my viewWhile I am still dialing things in, NOT saying things sound “100% the same” I am going off memory here to what I like and the tracks (music) I was listening to at the time.  The E2s and E1s are really close and more in the ballpark of each other…. Both in my opinion sound better than the A1s which between the three models are the ones that still lack “richness” at times .. it’s like the E1s and E2s are dialed in even out of the factory, more than the A1s.------------------------------Not sure what I can say specifically that will not make this review too long and boring.  I think between the A1s and E1s that are OFTEN (I got then at an identical price) about the same price…. Regular, lightning deals, or regular price + coupons … I’d totally go with the E1s, though I feel I am hating on the A1s (again these two models are SO SIMILAR it’s hard to tell them apart sometimes not counting the sound and case-shape) .. the A1s are not bad but these are just a bit better.The E2s I would not say are “a lot better” or worse than these but they are in the same ballpark … and for about $40 (not counting sales which would bring that down) … you could get both E1 and E2s.To be honest .. I have more than one pair of these E1s due to e-coupons and sales … so yes I recommend them

product_name: TOZO Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Premium Sound Performance Touch Control LED Digital Display Wireless Charging Case Earphones Black

reviews.review: After reading several reviews, these T12s seemed to be a very good deal. Especially for the price.I was quite skeptical because the last pair I just returned had some really great reviews too. However, I received my Tozo T12 Earbuds today, January 2, 2021. I received them just as all the video reviews stated with all the items included as advertised. Mine were charged to 85%. I followed the simple instructions and I was up and running in less than 5 minutes. I was seriously impressed with the sound quality. WOW!I let the earbuds and the base charge to 100%. I had some work to do in the garage that took about 1 hour. This gave me the time to play around with my new earbuds. Did I mention the sound quality? After several songs these  earbuds are incredible. They are light weight and seems like they will stay in place. I was climbing and bending over, moving freely with no discomfort in my ears. In fact I had forgot these were in my ears at one point. I was able to quickly adapt to the touch controls. Very easy.I was having a conversation with my wife (after I paused the music) and I still couldn't hear her clearly. I had to remove one of the ear pieces. The earbud really seals the outside noise very nicely. I'm going to try these when I use the trimmer this summer. They should act as a set of hearing protection and I can listen to music.But my real test is going to be when I use these at the gym. I only bought them for that purpose. For some reason, my gym loves to play some crap music. It sounds like they play the same song over and over and over. It is cruel and unusual punishment. The pair of earbuds I had and just returned never stayed in my ears. With a little sweat, I was constantly fussing with them and not having a good seal made the sound quality horrible. So we shall see if my Tozo T12s will do what the other one could not. From my short experience I have had so far I have confidence these WILL stay put and I will have the sound quality I was searching for. But I will soon find out on Monday!Update, today is January 20, 2021.Let me say, you will not be disappointed with the Tozo T12s.  After a little more than 3 weeks, I have used these while climbing up and down a ladder, bending over, under ear muffs (wood working) just about any position and these ear buds DO NOT fall out and are comfortable. But most importantly, I use them at the gym. I don't go to the gym to update my social status, I go there to sweat and I sweat a lot. These T12s have stayed in place and are comfortable. Never have I had to adjust or fuss with them after putting them in.You get a rich full range of sound. Deep bass and crisp highs. Incredible!! I'm hearing sounds that I have never heard from music that I have listened to for years.You have two sets of volume control. Your device, if turned way down, will affect the volume to the earbuds. And you have a volume control on the earbuds. Think of your device being the master volume control. If it is low or off you will not have very much volume at the earbuds even at full (on the earbuds). I set my devise almost up to full volume and control the earbuds from there.So far I have only had to charge the case only once in three weeks.The only negative thing I can say about these earbuds, the first week in the gym I was hearing a very loud popping sound from my left ear and only after the sweat started to flow. The popping happened with every step while running on the treadmill. It sounded like the cap on a jar when the vacuum seal was broken. But loud. I figured out that the silicone tip, after it was wet, was braking the seal between my ear and the silicone ear piece. I fixed that by buying a set of foam tips. I don't hear the popping anymore. But I do hear my bones rattling around now. I can't fix that. If you are experiencing this I think the foam tips can fix that. No need to buy an expensive pair. Here are the ones I bought. https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07SN4HP5Z/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o07_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 $7.I hope this helps someone. Trust me I'm confident that you will love these too. Especially at the $40 price point. Good luck!

great sound and comfort. dirt cheap and way better than the a1 model. sadly it says it has wireless charging but mine does not. otherwise worth every penny. i even threw my nc9 away because i like these better.

Background:I am a person that even if you ignore the other brand Earbuds I have and like, (with TOZO … I’d say Tribit and Earfun are up there) … I have quiet the collection of models from TOZO including the T6s (both variety), T9, NC2 and 2024 NC9s, A1s, Crystal Buds and Crystal Pods, the A3s, and I have experience with the original NC9s and NC7s (I am sure I am even forgetting a model or two) . Oh yeah and the E2s (to answer my own question about the E2s in comparison to these, I will get to that later)My intial thoughts (given that I did have these before my A1s but expected about the same thing) were that the sound BLEW me away for this price .. I do admit I got these for $19.99 with a 6 dollar off e-coupon to make these under $15 (before I go on, I still say these would be worth that $19.99)… after a first walk of a few miles with the DEFAULT “flat”/”standard” EQ I tried what I thought was the best option and while usually use custom EQ settings … I tried the “Rock” Preset and after two days of that… I felt these were dialed in.  JUST now I tried them again and while it’s so close to being “perfect” (so to speak…keep expectations in-check) … the midbass which IS boosted in the “Rock” preset is just a tad too much .. in the great TOZO app I pulled the first few bass sliders to A) line-up and B) are above the “zero” line but lower than the Rock preset(like I said in my A1 review, I plan on uploading my preset to the EQ Zone in the TOZO App … this gives you the ability to download other people’s EQ settings and apply them to YOUR TOZO buds with only a few clicks … VERY cool and handy) .This sound is really dialed in more to “exactly” how I like it.  The only thing  I may say about these vs say the 2024 NC9 SOUND … is that things seem more “refined” overall in the 2024 NC9 (crisper, more separation perhaps), but these are DARN GOODBefore I go on … Build quality, battery life (so far), and that sort of stuff … seems typical for TOZO … and that means “it’s great” … sure compared to some buds these may “feel a little cheaper” (say the T6s or 2024 NC9s) but THEY DO NOT feel “cheap”.  To try to clear up confusing … with cheap QUALITY buds “you get what you pay for… what’d you expect” comes to mind … what I am trying to say is that TOZO probably cut back on these to keep the price lower but they are still a good quality earbud and case.Comparisons- I will try to keep this short but informative(any .. old classic with no app support and 32hrs advertised battery life .. .or new style “classic” or “ergonomic edition” TOZO T6):- I think the T6s (not what I said about the build quality still being good on the E1s) MAYBE a little better but it’s “splitting hairs”.- Sound Quality … hard to say since the old T6s do not have app support hence no TOZO App EQ support…. STILL . With some EQ tweaking and I mean MINOR tweaking .. they are totally in the same ballpark … These E1s to me are ALOT closer in sound to the T6s than say they are to the A1sTOZO A1s:I can legit see TOZO making these E1s the “new gen” A1s they are so close and even making a little spreadsheet of features comparing the two here, there are only MINOR differences they are so close … on paper.- what I will say is that while I am dialing in my A1s EQ a little more … they have two issues to me with the sound.  A) say at 100% volume the A1s are where any other TOZO bud including these are at say 70% volume and that is an issue at times with tracks with lower volumes.  NOT terrible for the A1s but just something to note.  The A1s lack “body” or “richness” to me in the mids .. .at least compared to say the TOZO T6s for instance.  These E1s just need minor tweaking vs the A1s they are so much like and sound so much better.  I don’t feel the sound “blows me away” as much (if I forget I only paid $13.90 for these) as it did at first but it’s so good for this price range, I am nit-picking at that point. These have the punch in the low end (how much of a punch is what I am dialing in to my “perfect sound” listening to things from light jazz to rap and metal, here) that I feel the A1s lack at times.The E1s have a “more controlled “ bass to me …and without repeated tweaking of the EQ which I am still trying with the A1s .. I am not noticing that “syballant” sound on some of the tracks near the high-end.  (For the record I feel I am trashing the A1s… I have no plans on returning my A1s and I do NOT “hate them” .. I just feel these E1s OVERALL are better)Fit wise the A1s and E1s may not be “identical” but without trying them on as I am typing this review I cant remember if one is better … close enough to being the same for my tastes and that is “maybe not the perfect fit but TOTALLY comfortable”TOZO E2:This will answer my own question about the E2s before I bought those.  The style (even how the case opens uniquely) is really cool and I like that more than I expected.  The build quality of the E2s are about the same as these E1s in my viewWhile I am still dialing things in, NOT saying things sound “100% the same” I am going off memory here to what I like and the tracks (music) I was listening to at the time.  The E2s and E1s are really close and more in the ballpark of each other…. Both in my opinion sound better than the A1s which between the three models are the ones that still lack “richness” at times .. it’s like the E1s and E2s are dialed in even out of the factory, more than the A1s.------------------------------Not sure what I can say specifically that will not make this review too long and boring.  I think between the A1s and E1s that are OFTEN (I got then at an identical price) about the same price…. Regular, lightning deals, or regular price + coupons … I’d totally go with the E1s, though I feel I am hating on the A1s (again these two models are SO SIMILAR it’s hard to tell them apart sometimes not counting the sound and case-shape) .. the A1s are not bad but these are just a bit better.The E2s I would not say are “a lot better” or worse than these but they are in the same ballpark … and for about $40 (not counting sales which would bring that down) … you could get both E1 and E2s.To be honest .. I have more than one pair of these E1s due to e-coupons and sales … so yes I recommend them

To try to clear up confusing … with cheap QUALITY buds “you get what you pay for… what’d you expect” comes to mind … what I am trying to say is that TOZO probably cut back on these to keep the price lower but they are still a good quality earbud and case.Comparisons- I will try to keep this short but informative(any .. old classic with no app support and 32hrs advertised battery life .. .or new style “classic” or “ergonomic edition” TOZO T6):- I think the T6s (not what I said about the build quality still being good on the E1s) MAYBE a little better but it’s “splitting hairs”.- Sound Quality … hard to say since the old T6s do not have app support hence no TOZO App EQ support…. STILL . With some EQ tweaking and I mean MINOR tweaking .. they are totally in the same ballpark … These E1s to me are ALOT closer in sound to the T6s than say they are to the A1sTOZO A1s:I can legit see TOZO making these E1s the “new gen” A1s they are so close and even making a little spreadsheet of features comparing the two here, there are only MINOR differences they are so close … on paper.- what I will say is that while I am dialing in my A1s EQ a little more … they have two issues to me with the sound.  A) say at 100% volume the A1s are where any other TOZO bud including these are at say 70% volume and that is an issue at times with tracks with lower volumes.  NOT terrible for the A1s but just something to note.  The A1s lack “body” or “richness” to me in the mids .. .at least compared to say the TOZO T6s for instance.  These E1s just need minor tweaking vs the A1s they are so much like and sound so much better.  I don’t feel the sound “blows me away” as much (if I forget I only paid $13.90 for these) as it did at first but it’s so good for this price range, I am nit-picking at that point. These have the punch in the low end (how much of a punch is what I am dialing in to my “perfect sound” listening to things from light jazz to rap and metal, here) that I feel the A1s lack at times.The E1s have a “more controlled “ bass to me …and without repeated tweaking of the EQ which I am still trying with the A1s .. I am not noticing that “syballant” sound on some of the tracks near the high-end.  (For the record I feel I am trashing the A1s… I have no plans on returning my A1s and I do NOT “hate them” .. I just feel these E1s OVERALL are better)Fit wise the A1s and E1s may not be “identical” but without trying them on as I am typing this review I cant remember if one is better … close enough to being the same for my tastes and that is “maybe not the perfect fit but TOTALLY comfortable”TOZO E2:This will answer my own question about the E2s before I bought those.  The style (even how the case opens uniquely) is really cool and I like that more than I expected.  The build quality of the E2s are about the same as these E1s in my viewWhile I am still dialing things in, NOT saying things sound “100% the same” I am going off memory here to what I like and the tracks (music) I was listening to at the time.  The E2s and E1s are really close and more in the ballpark of each other…. Both in my opinion sound better than the A1s which between the three models are the ones that still lack “richness” at times .. it’s like the E1s and E2s are dialed in even out of the factory, more than the A1s.------------------------------Not sure what I can say specifically that will not make this review too long and boring.  I think between the A1s and E1s that are OFTEN (I got then at an identical price) about the same price…. Regular, lightning deals, or regular price + coupons … I’d totally go with the E1s, though I feel I am hating on the A1s (again these two models are SO SIMILAR it’s hard to tell them apart sometimes not counting the sound and case-shape) .. the A1s are not bad but these are just a bit better.The E2s I would not say are “a lot better” or worse than these but they are in the same ballpark … and for about $40 (not counting sales which would bring that down) … you could get both E1 and E2s.To be honest .. I have more than one pair of these E1s due to e-coupons and sales … so yes I recommend them

product_name: TOZO Wireless Earbuds Build in Mic Clear Calls Ergonomic Light Weight Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Headphones Waterproof Premium Stereo Sound Ear Buds 30H Playtime with 32 EQs via APP

reviews.review: After reading several reviews, these T12s seemed to be a very good deal. Especially for the price.I was quite skeptical because the last pair I just returned had some really great reviews too. However, I received my Tozo T12 Earbuds today, January 2, 2021. I received them just as all the video reviews stated with all the items included as advertised. Mine were charged to 85%. I followed the simple instructions and I was up and running in less than 5 minutes. I was seriously impressed with the sound quality. WOW!I let the earbuds and the base charge to 100%. I had some work to do in the garage that took about 1 hour. This gave me the time to play around with my new earbuds. Did I mention the sound quality? After several songs these  earbuds are incredible. They are light weight and seems like they will stay in place. I was climbing and bending over, moving freely with no discomfort in my ears. In fact I had forgot these were in my ears at one point. I was able to quickly adapt to the touch controls. Very easy.I was having a conversation with my wife (after I paused the music) and I still couldn't hear her clearly. I had to remove one of the ear pieces. The earbud really seals the outside noise very nicely. I'm going to try these when I use the trimmer this summer. They should act as a set of hearing protection and I can listen to music.But my real test is going to be when I use these at the gym. I only bought them for that purpose. For some reason, my gym loves to play some crap music. It sounds like they play the same song over and over and over. It is cruel and unusual punishment. The pair of earbuds I had and just returned never stayed in my ears. With a little sweat, I was constantly fussing with them and not having a good seal made the sound quality horrible. So we shall see if my Tozo T12s will do what the other one could not. From my short experience I have had so far I have confidence these WILL stay put and I will have the sound quality I was searching for. But I will soon find out on Monday!Update, today is January 20, 2021.Let me say, you will not be disappointed with the Tozo T12s.  After a little more than 3 weeks, I have used these while climbing up and down a ladder, bending over, under ear muffs (wood working) just about any position and these ear buds DO NOT fall out and are comfortable. But most importantly, I use them at the gym. I don't go to the gym to update my social status, I go there to sweat and I sweat a lot. These T12s have stayed in place and are comfortable. Never have I had to adjust or fuss with them after putting them in.You get a rich full range of sound. Deep bass and crisp highs. Incredible!! I'm hearing sounds that I have never heard from music that I have listened to for years.You have two sets of volume control. Your device, if turned way down, will affect the volume to the earbuds. And you have a volume control on the earbuds. Think of your device being the master volume control. If it is low or off you will not have very much volume at the earbuds even at full (on the earbuds). I set my devise almost up to full volume and control the earbuds from there.So far I have only had to charge the case only once in three weeks.The only negative thing I can say about these earbuds, the first week in the gym I was hearing a very loud popping sound from my left ear and only after the sweat started to flow. The popping happened with every step while running on the treadmill. It sounded like the cap on a jar when the vacuum seal was broken. But loud. I figured out that the silicone tip, after it was wet, was braking the seal between my ear and the silicone ear piece. I fixed that by buying a set of foam tips. I don't hear the popping anymore. But I do hear my bones rattling around now. I can't fix that. If you are experiencing this I think the foam tips can fix that. No need to buy an expensive pair. Here are the ones I bought. https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07SN4HP5Z/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o07_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 $7.I hope this helps someone. Trust me I'm confident that you will love these too. Especially at the $40 price point. Good luck!

great sound and comfort. dirt cheap and way better than the a1 model. sadly it says it has wireless charging but mine does not. otherwise worth every penny. i even threw my nc9 away because i like these better.

product_name: JBL Tune Buds 2 - True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds with JBL Spatial Sound and Smart Ambient Technology, 6 mics for Perfect Calls, up to 48Hrs of Playback, IP54 Dust & Water Resistant (Black)

reviews.review: What the heck kind of title is that you might ask???I have latest Apple Air Pods Pro... and it hard to compare yet I cheerfully have both.I constantly fret about losing my Apple buds with the charge down so I cant find them.It takes all the fun out of it for me.  ALSO the Apple don't have the base that I really like.I didn't want to get the JBL cheapest nor did I want to get the several hundred dollar version either.I have to compromise.. so .. HOPEFULLY this is helpful to someone on the fence like I was.1)JBL never feel secure in my ear and in trying to get them secure I inadvertently reset  or constantly cycle them.However.. Once in my ear.. and seated.. they are nice.. stay put and don't have that look I detest about myAplle ones.. I got the BLACK JBL TUNE BUDS 2 and they sort of dont stand out.  I hate the look that my earsalways have a "Runny Nose" look.. the dangling white thing hanging down.. I really appreciate JBL black.2)I have a very hard time figuring out how much charge is in my  JBL Tune Buds.  I only have battery clues thatare in the 3 white lights on the front of the case.  Fine... but I am never sure what charge is where and if buds are charged totally etc.  HOWEVER.. the JBL last through the night for me.  Apple seldom makes it ever so I have to use only one Apple bud at a time.  I really like the immersion of 2 buds to help sleep.  AND>>>  the JBL seem to last, for me, about twice as long as the Apple ones.  Still..  I never know what condition my c ondition is in HOWEVER.. if I get in a pinch.. I can drop back to 1 bud and go on forever with the JBL.3)The range .. for me.. is less for the JBL than the Apple  HOWEVER.. the JBL really are worth the slight drop in distance due to the lovely lovely BASS.. I love Bass.  That would make it hard for me to ditch or ghost the JBL.  I have 4 sets of buds.. A couple free sent for evaluation... however none stand up the quality of Apple Or JBL.  My evaluation free ones were in the $100 range so  I feel the comparison is valid.In conclusion... If you don't want that apple signature drippy white thing hanging down from your ear and you like a GOOOOD Bass thump and a REASONABLY fair price ... I think this is the one f or  you.  The lack of a good battery is still an issue but nor a deal breaker.  It is made up for by insanely fast charge and long battery life....Truly hope this helps a fence straddler..  Cheers

Very pleased with this product definitely worth the value of the money that I paid for clarity is perfect. Battery life is excellent quality of the sound. Is phenomenal and they fit comfortably in my ears? I couldn't ask for a better set of headphones. This is why I keep coming back to these connectivity is right on the money. Every time I hook them up complete clarity. I love these headphones, thank you so much.

Wife purchased these because she hates wired headphones. The sound quality was clear and the battery lasts. They came with a small case for storage when not in use and for ease of transport. Only issue is the part that goes into your ear does not have many size options. The smallest size was too big for her ear and caused discomfort. Because of this they would not stay I. Her ear and would fall out even if she move her head left or right.

These are the best earbuds/headphones I've ever owned. Great sound, really good bass. I love that you can switch between noise canceling and ambient with one touch. Battery charge lasts so long! I can go a week without charging them most times. Highly recommend.

Got these for under $50 bucks.  They are plastic but sounds good.  These are the mid level tier.  This newer version has some new features that the old one didn't have.  The sound can't compete to other top brand headphones or earbuds but it's good enough for what it is worth.

Eh, not so good in my opinion... not very loud, sound quality was there, but not loud enough for me... set up was a bit buggy, disconnected after a short time, was still playing music but the app said they were disconnected... too buggy, just wasn't impressed... too many burps!
This earbud really surprised me. Great comfort, good connectivity, well built, nice features and with a totally fantastic sound, this is one of the best earbuds at under $50.  5 star recommendation.

The earbuds feels great but the cover for the case feels flimsy. The Active Noise Cancellation is decent enough for the price point and the airbus lasts for quite a while with ANC on. The sound and bass feels top tier which is surprising. Kudos to JBL on developing the app for allowing customization in the sound profiles. Overall the airbuds feels great
