product_name: JLab Go Air Pop+ True Wireless Earbuds, in Ear Headphones, Bluetooth Earphones, 35H Playtime Ear Buds, Bluetooth Earbuds with Microphone, USB-C Charging Case, Dual Connect, EQ3 Sound, Black

reviews.review: The JLab Go Air Pop+ true wireless earbuds offer a solid balance between affordability and performance. They feature Bluetooth connectivity, a built-in microphone, and up to 35 hours of total battery life with the USB-C charging case. The earbuds deliver customizable EQ3 sound settings and dual connection support, making them convenient for everyday use. With a comfortable in-ear design, stylish color options, and a high customer rating, they are a reliable choice for users looking for quality wireless earbuds at a reasonable price.

...i don't know how these are only $20.  the sound quality is great for the price, but even more broadly, the VALUE IS THERE!  i have used exclusively airpods for the last five or so years, so much so that i kinda forgot that other options exist.  i was here, with one broken airpod (thanks to my dog--he's a good boy who doesn't chew on things but decided my airpod that unknowingly fell out of my pocket looked tasty, i guess?).  this stuck me only using the left one while i "saved up" somehow--during the holidays--for a new pair of pros.  after a week or two of using the one, it kinda dawned on me that, wait, there's more out there than just airpods lol.  my man watches a ton of tech stuff on youtube, so it's not like i was unaware, it just didn't click FOR ME that there is more out there that i could actually use!  once he turned me into an Apple girlie, i said there was no going back.  and we all know nothing works as well with Apple than more Apple, right?  it's true; the immediate connectivity and seamless pairing of airpods is unmatched.  i won't sit and pretend that's not true.  but these are a close second, as far as i can tell.  i don't listen to music at home very often, especially not in earbuds; i'm usually listening to news, podcasts, reactions, etc.  so i'm not looking for amazing sound quality by any means.  BUT THESE HAVE IT!  i put on TPAB to check and YEAH, THESE ARE GREAT!  the familiar songs i know so well weren't lost to some cheap engineering or budget components.  but for my normal use case scenario--listening to political news on a low volume while i'm working from home, listening to hip-hop media while cleaning the kitchen, or listening to reddit stories to drown out my man's snoring on those extra-loud nights, these are phenomenal.  also EXTREMELY comfortable.  i love the skin-tones they came out with, too.  that's so frickin cute and thoughtful that i had to get a pair in my own skintone even though i'm more of a white/black girlie.  it's so nice to have them blend in rather than be this white, obvious thing in my ear.  i LOVE the app--it shows the battery level, lets you check for updates MANUALLY, but also has an equalizer, CUSTOM TOUCH CONTROLS!!!!!!!!! which i of course used to mimic the touch control of airpods just for ease of use, allows you to even set a volume limit to protect your ears.  also comes with some built-in ambient noises which i am a big fan of.  and the awareness feature -- i am assuming this is maybe for people who go on walks???  or, like me, wear them a lot but still have conversations here and there.  i'm so super impressed with these LITERALLY TWENTY DOLLAR earbuds, i can't say it enough!!!i want to state that i am in no way compensated for this review, nor is this one of the increasingly-common AI-generated reviews you'll see on this platform, i am just genuinely so surprised by the quality and the comfort of these.  i think these are an amazing, affordable option for anyone who is ready to burst out of their expensive Apple comfort zone, or on a budget trying to save up for something they think is "nicer" (trust me...you might change your mind on that part).  these would make a wonderful gift for teens who lose things (i know all too well), or even just to have around as a backup pair.  if i were still working in an office, i'd probably buy another to keep in my desk.  they're THAT GOOD.still TBD is how well they work with a PC -- i've only used them with my phone, so far.  if i decide to try that out, i'll come back to update :)

I bought this pair of earbuds on sale for a very reasonable price, thinking that if it does not work out as expected, I would not be too upset about it.  But to my surprise, this pair of earbuds works really well, and the sound quality is solid.  The earbuds pack with operating features that are responsive.  The device connects to my phone right away and stay connected throughout my workout.  The pair of earbuds feel relatively comfortable to wear and fits snuggly in my ear canal.  The device stayed securely in my ears most of my workout routine, but there were a few occasions I had to adjust the fitting as I felt the device slipping out of ear.  I find it useful that the device comes with a very short built-in usb-c female charging cable that tucks underneath the charging case where I do not need to carry around a charging cable and comes with multiple silicone ear tips to make the device fit to my ear canal size.  I also like the "aware" feature that amplifies the surrounding sounds to make me aware of what is around me, especially when I am riding a bike on a busy street.  One thing I was not too thrilled about was the effort it takes to remove the earpiece out of the case.  Some reason I had hard time getting a good grip on the earpiece to remove it out of box, especially when the two earpieces are together in the case.  Perhaps it is my poor grip or the slippery material of the earpiece, but it took a lot more effort than I expected to remove the earpieces.  Other than that, this product offers good quality sound at a reasonable price.  The question is... how long the battery will last....

I’ve been using the JLab Go Air Pop+ earbuds for about two months now, and overall I’m really impressed with what you get for the price.First off, the sound quality is very decent for budget true wireless earbuds. They’re not meant to compete with premium models, but for everyday listening—music, videos, and calls—they sound clear and punchy. The EQ3 settings are a nice bonus and actually make a noticeable difference depending on what you’re listening to. The mic is not bad.. whoever I'm talking to can hear me but there's no noise canceling at all which can be annoying if you're in a noisy environment.Battery life is another strong point. I don’t find myself charging these often, and they easily last through multiple days of casual use. The dual connect feature is convenient too, especially if you want to use just one earbud at a time.There’s no active noise canceling, but that’s expected at this price point, and honestly I didn’t miss it. Passive isolation is fine for normal use.My only minor complaint is the built-in USB-C charging cable. It works, but it’s a bit annoying having to plug the case directly into an adapter instead of using a separate cable. Not a dealbreaker, just something to be aware of. Also the touch controls are a bit finicky and you have to learn the gestures for left and right buds separately.Overall, these are a great option if you’re looking for affordable, reliable earbuds with good sound and excellent battery life. I’d definitely recommend them to anyone who wants solid performance without spending a lot.

product_name: JBL Tune Buds - True wireless Noise Cancelling earbuds, JBL Pure Bass Sound, Bluetooth 5.3, 4-Mic technology for Crisp, Clear Calls, Up to 48 hours of battery life, Water and dust resistant (Black)

reviews.review: Very comfortable, decent noise cancelling, both ear bud & case batteries last better than my last pair of Sony earbuds. I do not have excellent ears, age, heredity, and industrial noise have seen to that, so the highs are probably wasted on me, but I have enjoyed the excellent image these buds create; I have a favorite recording of Handel's "Messiah", and it's easy to "see" where each soloist and group of singers, along with the parts of the orchestra are arranged, like you would at a live performance. As one group sings, then another one comes in you can hear the source coming from another area. The earbuds do work themselves out from time to time, but give warning & are easy to reposition. My last pair was the best Sony model, which I lost one of. I didn't want to drop another $250 , so I bought these. Now I never will. Tremendous value, with no indication of being cheap. One tiny issue: when dropped from waist high or higher onto a hard surface , the case invariably pops open and ejects both earbuds several feet. My fault, of course, but just saying. 10 month update: quality continues; sound is excellent & both earbud and holder batteries continue to last and last.

These earbuds sound awesome! The features are great! They are a bit bulky and it took me awhile to get them to fit and I was actually wearing them wrong to begin with, you’re supposed to put them in your ear and then turn them to the left to screw them into your ears and after I did that they fit so much better. The touch controls work great and I like how you can adjust the controls for your own liking on the app. I use these at work and I can hear everything going on around me as well as what I’m listening to with the ambient aware which is amazing to me. Definitely a lot of features for the money and the battery actually last about 10 hours! I have these connected to my iPhone 17 and they connect fast every time and Siri works just fine as well. The only con is that they are a bit bulky and I do have to adjust them at times but not a big deal to me.

I bought these earbuds and simply use them everyday. I find the battery durability satisfactory, as well as the charging time. I think it might take less than 30 minutes to charge completely. I had to change for the small eartips because the medium ones kept popping off, but nevertheless I find them comfortable in my ears. For me, the sound is pretty good and also the noise cancelling.

I ordered these to replace a set of cheaper buds that I'd used for several years. Overall I'm satisfied but not thrilled.As noted in other reviews, these are pretty difficult to put back into the case. You have to orient them just right and I find myself fumbling with them alot to get them in.Sound quality is acceptable, although they sound a little 'tinny' to me. The EQ gives some help, but I still have some work to get them to warm up. Maybe they'll be better after breaking in for a while.My biggest complaint is probably the noise reduction. It works a little, but I can still hear alot of what's going on around me. I was hoping for it to be more effective.I will probably keep them, but if I had more flexibility I'd probably shop around a bit more. I expected more for the price.

Very comfortable, I use the small tips and so far they haven’t tried to fall out when I shake my head around. I love the customization of the audio in the JBL app 😫😫 and they sound AMAZING. Usually earbuds hurt my ears especially the original AirPod style but these are very comfortable so far. The microphone sounds a little echoey but it’s still the best microphone I’ve ever personally had on a wireless earbud. You can connect Siri and Alexa to the gestures as well.

Pros:Reputation Brand NameGood sound with JBL Headphone appPlenty of bass with JBL Headphone appCONS:FitBluetooth disconnectsI purchased these after mt galaxy bud 2 died, due to one bud falling out into my pool last year then finally died about a month ago.My primary use for ear buds is listening to music while doing yard work (mowing, weed eating, edging) and during pool maintenance (brushing the walls and vacuuming).When I first received these, I downloaded the app and they paired nicely with no issues. Capsule charge was at 75% while both buds were at 100%.Next I tried placing them in my ears. When i placed them in my ears and turn them counterclockwise the weren't very comfortable and felt loose like they were going to fall out, however they did say in place when i tilted my head to either side and shook my head. These earbuds are supplied additional ear cushions. I tried the bigger ones and for my ears these were too big for my ear canal and would not stay in very well. I tried the smaller ones and these wouldn't hold in place. I'd like to say they were like Goldilocks and the 3 bears, but none were just right. The closest for me were the medium size, but I still didn't trust them staying in while doing yard work.Today was the first day I've had to really put them to the test. I place them in and fiddle with them for a bit to get a "snug" fit. The only way I could achieve this was by turning them so that the J in the JBL logo was at about a 180 degrees facing upwards.I started Spotify and proceeded to start the yard work. I noticed myself constantly fiddling with the earbud, because the kept feeling like the were going to fall out, enough so that I kept activating the voice pass through.After about a hour and a half into the yard work I was met with a bluetooth disconnected message. When I looked at my phone (Samsung galaxy s23 ultra) it showed bluetooth was enabled and the buds were paired. I started Spotify again and the music resumed. So I was like ok????I did about another 2 hrs of yard work and they stayed connected, but I still constantly felt they were going to fall out.With today's experience, I will not be using these near my poolWould I recommend these to a friend? Probably notDo i think these were worth what I paid for them? No, with the fit issue, these should cost closer to $19.99

product_name: realme Air 6 Pro True Wireless Earbuds, 50dB Noise Reduction, Adaptive Noise Cancelling to Ears and Environment, Hi-Res Sound, LDAC, 3D Audio, 40H Battery, Wireless Charging, Bluetooth 5.3, Grey

reviews.review: ConThe only bad part about these earbuds is the realme link app. It is not that great. One MUST create an account to use the app. Then, every time you open the app, asks you to sign in, but if you click on cancel, you are already signed in. This is just not acceptable.ProsThe earbuds have a feature called 360 spatial audio. What a difference this feature makes! The sound goes from an above average sound experience to an outstanding experience. I have to say, these are the best earbuds for the price that I have ever owned.I highly recommend these earbuds.
I’ve purchased these twice now (because I lost them the first time!) such a great value for money, fit well in my ears and never hurt. Solid feeling, not too heavy. And perfect sound quality to boot.

Easy setup, appealing case but most of all, super sound, great Eq and superior noise cancellation for immersive sound.I have migrated from Samsung Buds ( I lost my case and you simply cant get a replacement which does pairing) and I can say that the sound on these is much better and ear fit is more comfortable.

Great sound quality, great noise cancelling (can be turned off), good battery life. The magnets that hold the case closed are awful and the app isn't well supported for Android but it does have an interesting sound profile mode that improves the audio balancing—great for those who have worked too long around loud noises. The case is a bit "slippery" which can be annoying and the buds themselves can be fatiguing after a while. I wouldn't mind a more covert shape and color...
Excelente calidad de audio. Y eso que soy exigente con eso !
Estos audífonos son lo máximo los recomiendo 100%
El audífono izquierdo no encendía vino defectuoso de fábrica y para la devolución me cobraban $145.00 por el envío, desde Ecuador hacia Usa, me toco llevarlo a reparar.
Nice sound quality, worked with global Realme app. The case does scratch easily, though so i got a cover.

reviews.review: Amazing sound. The app was wonky but I figured it out.

It seems like every pair of buds I purchased with the exception of some LG buds caused my ears to flare up and leak/ itch.  These give me zero issues and fit well.  They sound good too.  Only thing is I wish they had wireless charging case.
Los auriculares realmente son muy buenos lo que no me gustó fue la app para ajustarlos que por lo menos en iPhone no sirve porque no puedo entrar a ella
Para mi son audifonos que estan muy bien trabajados y con gran calidad de sonido.
Excelente producto.
Best earbuds in budget 🔥
Muy buen producto, excelente vendedor.

Out of the box, the sound is very good. But the app that is used by these ear buds does not work in the United States as of Sept. 2025. I have worked with the manufacturer for the last 3 weeks to try to fix this issue. The final solution from them (after many failed solutions) was to change the country code of both my mobile phone & tablet ("realme link" app did not work on either device).  After I tried this, I finally was able to log on to the app...only to have it repeatedly freeze.I have no other choice but to return it.

product_name: Soundcore P40i by Anker, Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds, Adaptive Noise Cancelling to Environments, Heavy Bass, 60H Playtime, 2-in-1 Case and Phone Stand, IPX5, Wireless Charging, Bluetooth 5.3

reviews.review: I got these as a lower-cost replacement for the 1st generation AirPods Pro that I had used for a few years (before one of the pods finally met its unfortunate demise), and I’d say they’re just about as good all-around as those were. The fact that these are a quarter of the price of the AirPods Pro is certainly astounding, and I’m legitimately very impressed. I have always thought highly of Anker/Soundcore’s products, but I bought these for $36 (on sale) and certainly did not expect them to be THIS good LOLSound quality: While the sound quality is not quite as good as the AirPods Pro, I found the smart EQ feature on the Soundcore app to be EXTREMELY helpful in getting the p40i earbuds to sound much better. The noise-cancellation of these p40i is also comparable to that of the AirPods Pro 1st gen in my opinion, given that you fit them properly into your ears (and I’m often in a noisy environment). I am happy with the way these sound; I own an expensive pair of over-the-ear headphones and I am generally picky about sound. When I do wear earBUDS though, I am not super super picky, and I just want something that can (1) be easily connected to my device (2) have long battery life (3) be durable, water-resistant. Basically, for earbuds, I’m looking for a workhorse, and these do the job while sounding excellent for the price!Battery life and Durability: I wear these earbuds A LOT (I can hear street noise inside my house at all hours, and wearing earbuds helps me to focus); while walking, exercising, cleaning, cooking, and also while showering (when I am not submerging my head in water of course), and the p40i have been perfect for all of those! The battery life is incredible, even after months of daily use- the battery life of the p40i is definitely better than that of the 1st gen AP Pros (which struggled to maintain even 2 hrs use even when fully charged after 2 yrs). They are definitely water-resistant and durable as well, having survived multiple instances of light water exposure and multiple drops. I have not kept the case in any sort of protector, and there are essentially no visible scratches on the exterior (again, this is another category in which the p40i offers better performance in my opinion than Apple’s airpods).Connectivity + conclusion: I used to think only Apple products could connect so seamlessly to my iPhone (which is a major selling point of Apple’s Airpods), but these p40i changing my mind! 98% of the time, I am connecting these to my iPhone 14. Connection is seamless, and I have only had to fully re-pair my phone and the p40i once in 5 months of ownership (pairing is also incredibly easy). Also, I have a Dell laptop and a Surface Pro (Windows OS), and the connectivity between my computers and the p40i is a much nicer experience than that of my computers and the Apple AirPods.Conclusion: Honestly, I will not be buying any AirPods device again because of the experience I have had with the p40i- although Airpods work great and are nice, I’ve accepted that earbuds in general just won’t last forever with daily use, so it doesn’t make sense to spend over $100 on them. In 2-3 years when I’m ready for new earbuds, I will likely buy one of Soundcore’s more expensive models as I am truly impressed with the overall quality of these budget-friendly p40i earbuds!

So I have been a huge audiophile my entire life driven with rhythm and sound of nature and creation. I have tried many audio devices and have never quite had the experience that I've been able to receive from soundcore audio. I have purchased the p20, p3i, p40i's twice (one for me and my wife), I also have the space q45, I also recently purchased and reviewed the Aero Fit pro.As far as the p40i they fit a lot differently than the p3is. I personally had issues keeping them in my ears without them falling out which led to their demise in a toilet. However while I had them their voice quality seemed unmatched. Posting the capacity for six mics not only does the noise canceling work amazingly. Near comparable to the q45s capacity. The sound distribution is fantastic providing a deep into you sound.  Touch base control makes it interesting and easy to trigger. In my opinion they are not set up for movement like sports or other physical activities. Connectivity, functionality, battery life and volume control function flawlessly. And overall clarity and value for money they offer a little more than the cheaper variety.

I ordered 3 different earbuds all within a similar price range(+\- $30) to figure out which one I liked the most - Soundcore Liberty 4 NC, P40i, and JBL Vibe Beam. Here are my notes and comparisons.The Liberty 4 NC is my favorite but there is one aspect I don’t like.They Liberty’s are very clear with good bass and their app allows you to customize EQ settings which is deal breaker for me. (All three pairs have custom EQs within their respective apps). The noise cancellation is great, comparable or even better than AirPros 2 and the fit is superb and on par with the P40i.The JBL Vibe was less comfortable but more so than JBL Tune(ordered these a while back). The JBL Vibes are not noise canceling and I knew that before hand so I’m not knocking it.The JBLs are fine for the price point but not the best for quality as they use 8mm drivers vs 11mm drivers for the Soundcore.The one thing I don’t like with the Liberty’s is the slightest white noise I get when between songs or silent parts. The P40i’s don’t have that problem. The P40i have great bass and fit just as well but they lack in higher frequencies and that’s important for audiophiles. The P40i also have a much friendlier app interface with many more preset features. BUT the Liberty’s have an option to set up your “ideal listening EQ” and that is a great feature as it adjusts to your preferred sound through samples and takes the guess work out.Overall the Liberty 4 NC’s took the cake with respect to comfort and sound quality. To me, it was worth the extra $. I can’t speak on longevity as I received all three and have been testing them individually the past couple days.
